h3. catalogs/list
{panel:title=catalogs/list|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#003b6f|titleBGColor=#003b6f|titleColor=#a6b8c7|bgColor=#ffffff}
    *Summary:* List catalogs
    *Description:* Fetch catalogs owned by the &quot;operation user_account&quot;.
- By default, the &quot;operation user_account&quot; is the token user_account.

Optional: Business Access: Specify an &lt;code&gt;ad_account_id&lt;/code&gt; (obtained via &lt;a href&#x3D;&#39;/docs/api/v5/#operation/ad_accounts/list&#39;&gt;List ad accounts&lt;/a&gt;) to use the owner of that ad_account as the &quot;operation user_account&quot;. In order to do this, the token user_account must have one of the following &lt;a href&#x3D;&quot;https://help.pinterest.com/en/business/article/share-and-manage-access-to-your-ad-accounts&quot;&gt;Business Access&lt;/a&gt; roles on the ad_account: Owner, Admin, Catalogs Manager.

&lt;a href&#x3D;&#39;/docs/shopping/catalog/&#39;&gt;Learn more&lt;/a&gt;

	|| HttpMethod | {status:colour=Yellow|title=get|subtle=false} |

    || Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}/catalogs{noformat} |
    || Base Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}https://api.pinterest.com/v5{noformat} |

h3. catalogsProductGroupPins/list
{panel:title=catalogsProductGroupPins/list|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#003b6f|titleBGColor=#003b6f|titleColor=#a6b8c7|bgColor=#ffffff}
    *Summary:* List products for a Product Group
    *Description:* Get a list of product pins for a given Catalogs Product Group Id owned by the &quot;operation user_account&quot;.
- By default, the &quot;operation user_account&quot; is the token user_account.

Optional: Business Access: Specify an &lt;code&gt;ad_account_id&lt;/code&gt; (obtained via &lt;a href&#x3D;&#39;/docs/api/v5/#operation/ad_accounts/list&#39;&gt;List ad accounts&lt;/a&gt;) to use the owner of that ad_account as the &quot;operation user_account&quot;. In order to do this, the token user_account must have one of the following &lt;a href&#x3D;&quot;https://help.pinterest.com/en/business/article/share-and-manage-access-to-your-ad-accounts&quot;&gt;Business Access&lt;/a&gt; roles on the ad_account: Owner, Admin, Catalogs Manager.

&lt;a href&#x3D;&#39;/docs/shopping/catalog/&#39;&gt;Learn more&lt;/a&gt;

	|| HttpMethod | {status:colour=Yellow|title=get|subtle=false} |

h3. catalogsProductGroups/create
{panel:title=catalogsProductGroups/create|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#003b6f|titleBGColor=#003b6f|titleColor=#a6b8c7|bgColor=#ffffff}
    *Summary:* Create product group
    *Description:* Create product group to use in Catalogs owned by the &quot;operation user_account&quot;.
- By default, the &quot;operation user_account&quot; is the token user_account.

Optional: Business Access: Specify an &lt;code&gt;ad_account_id&lt;/code&gt; (obtained via &lt;a href&#x3D;&#39;/docs/api/v5/#operation/ad_accounts/list&#39;&gt;List ad accounts&lt;/a&gt;) to use the owner of that ad_account as the &quot;operation user_account&quot;. In order to do this, the token user_account must have one of the following &lt;a href&#x3D;&quot;https://help.pinterest.com/en/business/article/share-and-manage-access-to-your-ad-accounts&quot;&gt;Business Access&lt;/a&gt; roles on the ad_account: Owner, Admin, Catalogs Manager.

&lt;a href&#x3D;&#39;/docs/shopping/catalog/&#39;&gt;Learn more&lt;/a&gt;

	|| HttpMethod | {status:colour=Yellow|title=post|subtle=false} |
    || Protocol | {noformat:nopanel=true}https{noformat} |
    || Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}/catalogs/product_groups{noformat} |
    || Base Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}https://api.pinterest.com/v5{noformat} |
    || Produces | {noformat:nopanel=true}application/json {noformat} |
----
h4. Parameters

h5. Body Parameter
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |CatalogsProductGroupsCreateRequest |Request object used to created a catalogs product group. | CatalogsProductGroupsCreateRequest | (/) | |  |  |


h5. Query Parameters
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |ad_account_id |Unique identifier of an ad account. | String | (x) |null | /^\\d+$/ |  |

h3. catalogsProductGroups/delete
{panel:title=catalogsProductGroups/delete|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#003b6f|titleBGColor=#003b6f|titleColor=#a6b8c7|bgColor=#ffffff}
    *Summary:* Delete product group
    *Description:* Delete a product group owned by the &quot;operation user_account&quot; from being in use in Catalogs.
- By default, the &quot;operation user_account&quot; is the token user_account.

Optional: Business Access: Specify an &lt;code&gt;ad_account_id&lt;/code&gt; (obtained via &lt;a href&#x3D;&#39;/docs/api/v5/#operation/ad_accounts/list&#39;&gt;List ad accounts&lt;/a&gt;) to use the owner of that ad_account as the &quot;operation user_account&quot;. In order to do this, the token user_account must have one of the following &lt;a href&#x3D;&quot;https://help.pinterest.com/en/business/article/share-and-manage-access-to-your-ad-accounts&quot;&gt;Business Access&lt;/a&gt; roles on the ad_account: Owner, Admin, Catalogs Manager.

&lt;a href&#x3D;&#39;/docs/shopping/catalog/&#39;&gt;Learn more&lt;/a&gt;

	|| HttpMethod | {status:colour=Yellow|title=delete|subtle=false} |
    || Protocol | {noformat:nopanel=true}https{noformat} |
    || Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}/catalogs/product_groups/{product_group_id}{noformat} |
    || Base Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}https://api.pinterest.com/v5{noformat} |
    || Produces | {noformat:nopanel=true}application/json {noformat} |
----
h4. Parameters
h5. Path Parameters
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |product_group_id |Unique identifier of a product group | String | (/) |null | /^\\d+$/ |  |



h5. Query Parameters
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |ad_account_id |Unique identifier of an ad account. | String | (x) |null | /^\\d+$/ |  |
----
h4. Responses

h3. catalogsProductGroups/get
{panel:title=catalogsProductGroups/get|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#003b6f|titleBGColor=#003b6f|titleColor=#a6b8c7|bgColor=#ffffff}
    *Summary:* Get product group
    *Description:* Get a singe product group for a given Catalogs Product Group Id owned by the &quot;operation user_account&quot;.
- By default, the &quot;operation user_account&quot; is the token user_account.

Optional: Business Access: Specify an &lt;code&gt;ad_account_id&lt;/code&gt; (obtained via &lt;a href&#x3D;&#39;/docs/api/v5/#operation/ad_accounts/list&#39;&gt;List ad accounts&lt;/a&gt;) to use the owner of that ad_account as the &quot;operation user_account&quot;. In order to do this, the token user_account must have one of the following &lt;a href&#x3D;&quot;https://help.pinterest.com/en/business/article/share-and-manage-access-to-your-ad-accounts&quot;&gt;Business Access&lt;/a&gt; roles on the ad_account: Owner, Admin, Catalogs Manager.

&lt;a href&#x3D;&#39;/docs/shopping/catalog/&#39;&gt;Learn more&lt;/a&gt;

	|| HttpMethod | {status:colour=Yellow|title=get|subtle=false} |
    || Protocol | {noformat:nopanel=true}https{noformat} |

    || Base Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}https://api.pinterest.com/v5{noformat} |

h3. catalogsProductGroups/list
{panel:title=catalogsProductGroups/list|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#003b6f|titleBGColor=#003b6f|titleColor=#a6b8c7|bgColor=#ffffff}
    *Summary:* List product groups
    *Description:* Get a list of product groups for a given Catalogs Feed Id owned by the &quot;operation user_account&quot;.
- By default, the &quot;operation user_account&quot; is the token user_account.

Optional: Business Access: Specify an &lt;code&gt;ad_account_id&lt;/code&gt; (obtained via &lt;a href&#x3D;&#39;/docs/api/v5/#operation/ad_accounts/list&#39;&gt;List ad accounts&lt;/a&gt;) to use the owner of that ad_account as the &quot;operation user_account&quot;. In order to do this, the token user_account must have one of the following &lt;a href&#x3D;&quot;https://help.pinterest.com/en/business/article/share-and-manage-access-to-your-ad-accounts&quot;&gt;Business Access&lt;/a&gt; roles on the ad_account: Owner, Admin, Catalogs Manager.

&lt;a href&#x3D;&#39;/docs/shopping/catalog/&#39;&gt;Learn more&lt;/a&gt;

	|| HttpMethod | {status:colour=Yellow|title=get|subtle=false} |
    || Protocol | {noformat:nopanel=true}https{noformat} |
    || Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}/catalogs/product_groups{noformat} |
    || Base Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}https://api.pinterest.com/v5{noformat} |
    || Produces | {noformat:nopanel=true}application/json {noformat} |
----
h4. Parameters



h5. Query Parameters
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |feed_id |Filter entities for a given feed_id. If not given, all feeds are considered. | String | (x) |null | /^\\d+$/ |  ||catalog_id |Filter entities for a given catalog_id. If not given, all catalogs are considered. | String | (x) |null | /^\\d+$/ |  ||bookmark |Cursor used to fetch the next page of items | String | (x) |null |  |  ||page_size |Maximum number of items to include in a single page of the response. See documentation on &lt;a href&#x3D;&#39;/docs/getting-started/pagination/&#39;&gt;Pagination&lt;/a&gt; for more information. | Integer | (x) |25 |  |  ||ad_account_id |Unique identifier of an ad account. | String | (x) |null | /^\\d+$/ |  |
----
h4. Responses

    	|| Status Code | {status:colour=Green|title=200|subtle=false} |
    	|| Message | Success |
    	|| Response Type | catalogs_product_groups_list_200_response |
    	|| Response Model | [catalogs_product_groups_list_200_response Model|#catalogs_product_groups_list_200_responseModelAnchor|Jump to model] |

h3. catalogsProductGroups/productCountsGet
{panel:title=catalogsProductGroups/productCountsGet|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#003b6f|titleBGColor=#003b6f|titleColor=#a6b8c7|bgColor=#ffffff}
    *Summary:* Get product counts for a Product Group
    *Description:* Get a product counts for a given Catalogs Product Group owned by the &quot;operation user_account&quot;.
- By default, the &quot;operation user_account&quot; is the token user_account.

Optional: Business Access: Specify an &lt;code&gt;ad_account_id&lt;/code&gt; (obtained via &lt;a href&#x3D;&#39;/docs/api/v5/#operation/ad_accounts/list&#39;&gt;List ad accounts&lt;/a&gt;) to use the owner of that ad_account as the &quot;operation user_account&quot;. In order to do this, the token user_account must have one of the following &lt;a href&#x3D;&quot;https://help.pinterest.com/en/business/article/share-and-manage-access-to-your-ad-accounts&quot;&gt;Business Access&lt;/a&gt; roles on the ad_account: Owner, Admin, Catalogs Manager.

&lt;a href&#x3D;&#39;/docs/shopping/catalog/&#39;&gt;Learn more&lt;/a&gt;

	|| HttpMethod | {status:colour=Yellow|title=get|subtle=false} |
    || Protocol | {noformat:nopanel=true}https{noformat} |
    || Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}/catalogs/product_groups/{product_group_id}/product_counts{noformat} |
    || Base Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}https://api.pinterest.com/v5{noformat} |
    || Produces | {noformat:nopanel=true}application/json {noformat} |
----
h4. Parameters
h5. Path Parameters
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |product_group_id |Unique identifier of a product group | String | (/) |null | /^\\d+$/ |  |



h5. Query Parameters
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |ad_account_id |Unique identifier of an ad account. | String | (x) |null | /^\\d+$/ |  |
----
h4. Responses

    	|| Status Code | {status:colour=Green|title=200|subtle=false} |
    	|| Message | Success |
    	|| Response Type | CatalogsProductGroupProductCounts |
    	|| Response Model | [CatalogsProductGroupProductCounts Model|#CatalogsProductGroupProductCountsModelAnchor|Jump to model] |
    	|| Response Schema | {code:collapse=true}{
  "description" : "Success",
  "content" : {
    "application/json" : {
      "schema" : {
        "$ref" : "#/components/schemas/CatalogsProductGroupProductCounts"
      }
    }
  }
}{code} |
       


    	|| Status Code | {status:colour=Orange|title=404|subtle=false} |
    	|| Message | Product Group Not Found. |
    	|| Response Type | Error |
    	|| Response Model | [Error Model|#ErrorModelAnchor|Jump to model] |
    	|| Response Schema | {code:collapse=true}{

  "content" : {

          "value" : {
            "code" : 4180,
            "message" : "Sorry! We could not find your catalogs product group."
          }
        }
      }
    }
  }
}{code} |
       


    	|| Status Code | {status:colour=Orange|title=409|subtle=false} |

h3. catalogsProductGroups/update
{panel:title=catalogsProductGroups/update|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#003b6f|titleBGColor=#003b6f|titleColor=#a6b8c7|bgColor=#ffffff}
    *Summary:* Update product group
    *Description:* Update product group owned by the &quot;operation user_account&quot; to use in Catalogs.
- By default, the &quot;operation user_account&quot; is the token user_account.

Optional: Business Access: Specify an &lt;code&gt;ad_account_id&lt;/code&gt; (obtained via &lt;a href&#x3D;&#39;/docs/api/v5/#operation/ad_accounts/list&#39;&gt;List ad accounts&lt;/a&gt;) to use the owner of that ad_account as the &quot;operation user_account&quot;. In order to do this, the token user_account must have one of the following &lt;a href&#x3D;&quot;https://help.pinterest.com/en/business/article/share-and-manage-access-to-your-ad-accounts&quot;&gt;Business Access&lt;/a&gt; roles on the ad_account: Owner, Admin, Catalogs Manager.

&lt;a href&#x3D;&#39;/docs/shopping/catalog/&#39;&gt;Learn more&lt;/a&gt;

	|| HttpMethod | {status:colour=Yellow|title=patch|subtle=false} |
    || Protocol | {noformat:nopanel=true}https{noformat} |
    || Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}/catalogs/product_groups/{product_group_id}{noformat} |
    || Base Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}https://api.pinterest.com/v5{noformat} |
    || Produces | {noformat:nopanel=true}application/json {noformat} |
----
h4. Parameters
h5. Path Parameters
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |product_group_id |Unique identifier of a product group | String | (/) |null | /^\\d+$/ |  |

h5. Body Parameter
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |CatalogsProductGroupsUpdateRequest |Request object used to Update a catalogs product group. | CatalogsProductGroupsUpdateRequest | (/) | |  |  |


h5. Query Parameters
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |ad_account_id |Unique identifier of an ad account. | String | (x) |null | /^\\d+$/ |  |
----
h4. Responses

h3. feedProcessingResults/list
{panel:title=feedProcessingResults/list|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#003b6f|titleBGColor=#003b6f|titleColor=#a6b8c7|bgColor=#ffffff}
    *Summary:* List processing results for a given feed
    *Description:* Fetch a feed processing results owned by the &quot;operation user_account&quot;. Please note that for now the bookmark parameter is not functional and only the first page will be available until it is implemented in some release in the near future.
- By default, the &quot;operation user_account&quot; is the token user_account.

Optional: Business Access: Specify an &lt;code&gt;ad_account_id&lt;/code&gt; (obtained via &lt;a href&#x3D;&#39;/docs/api/v5/#operation/ad_accounts/list&#39;&gt;List ad accounts&lt;/a&gt;) to use the owner of that ad_account as the &quot;operation user_account&quot;. In order to do this, the token user_account must have one of the following &lt;a href&#x3D;&quot;https://help.pinterest.com/en/business/article/share-and-manage-access-to-your-ad-accounts&quot;&gt;Business Access&lt;/a&gt; roles on the ad_account: Owner, Admin, Catalogs Manager.

&lt;a href&#x3D;&#39;/docs/shopping/catalog/&#39;&gt;Learn more&lt;/a&gt;

	|| HttpMethod | {status:colour=Yellow|title=get|subtle=false} |
    || Protocol | {noformat:nopanel=true}https{noformat} |
    || Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}/catalogs/feeds/{feed_id}/processing_results{noformat} |
    || Base Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}https://api.pinterest.com/v5{noformat} |
    || Produces | {noformat:nopanel=true}application/json {noformat} |
----
h4. Parameters
h5. Path Parameters
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |feed_id |Unique identifier of a feed | String | (/) |null | /^\\d+$/ |  |



h5. Query Parameters
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |bookmark |Cursor used to fetch the next page of items | String | (x) |null |  |  ||page_size |Maximum number of items to include in a single page of the response. See documentation on &lt;a href&#x3D;&#39;/docs/getting-started/pagination/&#39;&gt;Pagination&lt;/a&gt; for more information. | Integer | (x) |25 |  |  ||ad_account_id |Unique identifier of an ad account. | String | (x) |null | /^\\d+$/ |  |
----
h4. Responses

    	|| Status Code | {status:colour=Green|title=200|subtle=false} |
    	|| Message | Success |
    	|| Response Type | feed_processing_results_list_200_response |
    	|| Response Model | [feed_processing_results_list_200_response Model|#feed_processing_results_list_200_responseModelAnchor|Jump to model] |
    	|| Response Schema | {code:collapse=true}{
  "description" : "Success",
  "content" : {
    "application/json" : {
      "schema" : {
        "$ref" : "#/components/schemas/feed_processing_results_list_200_response"
      }
    }
  }
}{code} |
       


    	|| Status Code | {status:colour=Orange|title=400|subtle=false} |
    	|| Message | Invalid parameters. |
    	|| Response Type | Error |
    	|| Response Model | [Error Model|#ErrorModelAnchor|Jump to model] |
    	|| Response Schema | {code:collapse=true}{
  "description" : "Invalid parameters.",
  "content" : {

{panel}



h3. feeds/create
{panel:title=feeds/create|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#003b6f|titleBGColor=#003b6f|titleColor=#a6b8c7|bgColor=#ffffff}
    *Summary:* Create feed
    *Description:* Create a new feed owned by the &quot;operation user_account&quot;.
- By default, the &quot;operation user_account&quot; is the token user_account.

Please, be aware that &quot;default_country&quot;
and &quot;default_locale&quot; are not required in the spec for forward compatibility
but for now the API will not accept requests without those fields.

Optional: Business Access: Specify an &lt;code&gt;ad_account_id&lt;/code&gt; (obtained via &lt;a href&#x3D;&#39;/docs/api/v5/#operation/ad_accounts/list&#39;&gt;List ad accounts&lt;/a&gt;) to use the owner of that ad_account as the &quot;operation user_account&quot;. In order to do this, the token user_account must have one of the following &lt;a href&#x3D;&quot;https://help.pinterest.com/en/business/article/share-and-manage-access-to-your-ad-accounts&quot;&gt;Business Access&lt;/a&gt; roles on the ad_account: Owner, Admin, Catalogs Manager.

For Retail partners, refer to &lt;a href&#x3D;&#39;https://help.pinterest.com/en/business/article/before-you-get-started-with-catalogs&#39;&gt;Before you get started with Catalogs&lt;/a&gt;. For Hotel parterns, refer to &lt;a href&#x3D;&#39;/docs/shopping/catalog/&#39;&gt;Pinterest API for shopping&lt;/a&gt;.

	|| HttpMethod | {status:colour=Yellow|title=post|subtle=false} |
    || Protocol | {noformat:nopanel=true}https{noformat} |
    || Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}/catalogs/feeds{noformat} |
    || Base Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}https://api.pinterest.com/v5{noformat} |
    || Produces | {noformat:nopanel=true}application/json {noformat} |
----
h4. Parameters

h5. Body Parameter
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |FeedsCreateRequest |Request object used to created a feed. | FeedsCreateRequest | (/) | |  |  |


h5. Query Parameters
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |ad_account_id |Unique identifier of an ad account. | String | (x) |null | /^\\d+$/ |  |
----
h4. Responses

    	|| Status Code | {status:colour=Green|title=201|subtle=false} |
    	|| Message | Success |
    	|| Response Type | CatalogsFeed |

{panel}



h3. feeds/delete
{panel:title=feeds/delete|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#003b6f|titleBGColor=#003b6f|titleColor=#a6b8c7|bgColor=#ffffff}
    *Summary:* Delete feed
    *Description:* Delete a feed owned by the &quot;operating user_account&quot;.
- By default, the &quot;operation user_account&quot; is the token user_account.

Optional: Business Access: Specify an &lt;code&gt;ad_account_id&lt;/code&gt; (obtained via &lt;a href&#x3D;&#39;/docs/api/v5/#operation/ad_accounts/list&#39;&gt;List ad accounts&lt;/a&gt;) to use the owner of that ad_account as the &quot;operation user_account&quot;. In order to do this, the token user_account must have one of the following &lt;a href&#x3D;&quot;https://help.pinterest.com/en/business/article/share-and-manage-access-to-your-ad-accounts&quot;&gt;Business Access&lt;/a&gt; roles on the ad_account: Owner, Admin, Catalogs Manager.

For Retail partners, refer to &lt;a href&#x3D;&#39;https://help.pinterest.com/en/business/article/before-you-get-started-with-catalogs&#39;&gt;Before you get started with Catalogs&lt;/a&gt;. For Hotel parterns, refer to &lt;a href&#x3D;&#39;/docs/shopping/catalog/&#39;&gt;Pinterest API for shopping&lt;/a&gt;.

	|| HttpMethod | {status:colour=Yellow|title=delete|subtle=false} |
    || Protocol | {noformat:nopanel=true}https{noformat} |
    || Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}/catalogs/feeds/{feed_id}{noformat} |
    || Base Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}https://api.pinterest.com/v5{noformat} |
    || Produces | {noformat:nopanel=true}application/json {noformat} |
----
h4. Parameters
h5. Path Parameters
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |feed_id |Unique identifier of a feed | String | (/) |null | /^\\d+$/ |  |



h5. Query Parameters
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |ad_account_id |Unique identifier of an ad account. | String | (x) |null | /^\\d+$/ |  |
----
h4. Responses

    	|| Status Code | {status:colour=Green|title=204|subtle=false} |
    	|| Message | Feed deleted successfully. |
    	|| Response Type |  |
    	|| Response Model | [ Model|#ModelAnchor|Jump to model] |
    	|| Response Schema | {code:collapse=true}{
  "description" : "Feed deleted successfully."
}{code} |
       


    	|| Status Code | {status:colour=Orange|title=400|subtle=false} |
    	|| Message | Invalid feed parameters. |
    	|| Response Type | Error |
    	|| Response Model | [Error Model|#ErrorModelAnchor|Jump to model] |
    	|| Response Schema | {code:collapse=true}{
  "description" : "Invalid feed parameters.",
  "content" : {
    "application/json" : {
      "schema" : {
        "$ref" : "#/components/schemas/Error"
      },
      "examples" : {
        "InvalidRequest" : {
          "value" : {
            "code" : 1,
            "message" : "'feed_id' value '1511851494501_' must match the pattern: ^\\d+$\"}"
          }
        }
      }
    }
  }
}{code} |
       


    	|| Status Code | {status:colour=Orange|title=403|subtle=false} |
    	|| Message | Forbidden. Account not approved for feed mutations yet. |
    	|| Response Type | Error |
    	|| Response Model | [Error Model|#ErrorModelAnchor|Jump to model] |
    	|| Response Schema | {code:collapse=true}{
  "description" : "Forbidden. Account not approved for feed mutations yet.",
  "content" : {
    "application/json" : {
      "schema" : {
        "$ref" : "#/components/schemas/Error"
      },
      "examples" : {
        "MerchantDisapproved" : {
          "value" : {
            "code" : 2625,
            "message" : "Sorry, you cannot perform this action. Account is disapproved."
          }
        },
        "MerchantUnderReview" : {
          "value" : {
            "code" : 2626,
            "message" : "Sorry, you cannot perform this action. Account is under review."
          }
        }
      }
    }
  }
}{code} |
       


    	|| Status Code | {status:colour=Orange|title=404|subtle=false} |
    	|| Message | Data feed not found. |
    	|| Response Type | Error |
    	|| Response Model | [Error Model|#ErrorModelAnchor|Jump to model] |
    	|| Response Schema | {code:collapse=true}{
  "description" : "Data feed not found.",
  "content" : {
    "application/json" : {
      "schema" : {
        "$ref" : "#/components/schemas/Error"
      },
      "examples" : {
        "FeedNotFound" : {
          "value" : {
            "code" : 4161,
            "message" : "Sorry! We could not find your catalogs feed."
          }
        }
      }
    }
  }
}{code} |
       


    	|| Status Code | {status:colour=Orange|title=409|subtle=false} |
    	|| Message | Conflict. Can&#39;t delete a feed with active promotions. |
    	|| Response Type | Error |
    	|| Response Model | [Error Model|#ErrorModelAnchor|Jump to model] |
    	|| Response Schema | {code:collapse=true}{
  "description" : "Conflict. Can't delete a feed with active promotions.",
  "content" : {
    "application/json" : {
      "schema" : {
        "$ref" : "#/components/schemas/Error"
      },
      "examples" : {
        "FeedHasActivePromotions" : {
          "value" : {
            "code" : 4162,
            "message" : "We can't disable a Product Group with active promotions."
          }
        }
      }
    }
  }
}{code} |
       


    	|| Status Code | {status:colour=Red|title=0|subtle=false} |
    	|| Message | Unexpected error |
    	|| Response Type | Error |
    	|| Response Model | [Error Model|#ErrorModelAnchor|Jump to model] |
    	|| Response Schema | {code:collapse=true}{
  "description" : "Unexpected error",
  "content" : {
    "application/json" : {
      "schema" : {
        "$ref" : "#/components/schemas/Error"
      }
    }
  }
}{code} |

h3. feeds/get
{panel:title=feeds/get|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#003b6f|titleBGColor=#003b6f|titleColor=#a6b8c7|bgColor=#ffffff}
    *Summary:* Get feed
    *Description:* Get a single feed owned by the &quot;operation user_account&quot;.
- By default, the &quot;operation user_account&quot; is the token user_account.

Optional: Business Access: Specify an &lt;code&gt;ad_account_id&lt;/code&gt; (obtained via &lt;a href&#x3D;&#39;/docs/api/v5/#operation/ad_accounts/list&#39;&gt;List ad accounts&lt;/a&gt;) to use the owner of that ad_account as the &quot;operation user_account&quot;. In order to do this, the token user_account must have one of the following &lt;a href&#x3D;&quot;https://help.pinterest.com/en/business/article/share-and-manage-access-to-your-ad-accounts&quot;&gt;Business Access&lt;/a&gt; roles on the ad_account: Owner, Admin, Catalogs Manager.

For Retail partners, refer to &lt;a href&#x3D;&#39;https://help.pinterest.com/en/business/article/before-you-get-started-with-catalogs&#39;&gt;Before you get started with Catalogs&lt;/a&gt;. For Hotel parterns, refer to &lt;a href&#x3D;&#39;/docs/shopping/catalog/&#39;&gt;Pinterest API for shopping&lt;/a&gt;.

	|| HttpMethod | {status:colour=Yellow|title=get|subtle=false} |
    || Protocol | {noformat:nopanel=true}https{noformat} |
    || Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}/catalogs/feeds/{feed_id}{noformat} |
    || Base Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}https://api.pinterest.com/v5{noformat} |
    || Produces | {noformat:nopanel=true}application/json {noformat} |
----

h5. Path Parameters
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |feed_id |Unique identifier of a feed | String | (/) |null | /^\\d+$/ |  |

        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||

h3. feeds/list
{panel:title=feeds/list|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#003b6f|titleBGColor=#003b6f|titleColor=#a6b8c7|bgColor=#ffffff}
    *Summary:* List feeds
    *Description:* Fetch feeds owned by the &quot;operation user_account&quot;.
- By default, the &quot;operation user_account&quot; is the token user_account.

Optional: Business Access: Specify an &lt;code&gt;ad_account_id&lt;/code&gt; (obtained via &lt;a href&#x3D;&#39;/docs/api/v5/#operation/ad_accounts/list&#39;&gt;List ad accounts&lt;/a&gt;) to use the owner of that ad_account as the &quot;operation user_account&quot;. In order to do this, the token user_account must have one of the following &lt;a href&#x3D;&quot;https://help.pinterest.com/en/business/article/share-and-manage-access-to-your-ad-accounts&quot;&gt;Business Access&lt;/a&gt; roles on the ad_account: Owner, Admin, Catalogs Manager.

For Retail partners, refer to &lt;a href&#x3D;&#39;https://help.pinterest.com/en/business/article/before-you-get-started-with-catalogs&#39;&gt;Before you get started with Catalogs&lt;/a&gt;. For Hotel parterns, refer to &lt;a href&#x3D;&#39;/docs/shopping/catalog/&#39;&gt;Pinterest API for shopping&lt;/a&gt;.

	|| HttpMethod | {status:colour=Yellow|title=get|subtle=false} |
    || Protocol | {noformat:nopanel=true}https{noformat} |
    || Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}/catalogs/feeds{noformat} |
    || Base Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}https://api.pinterest.com/v5{noformat} |
    || Produces | {noformat:nopanel=true}application/json {noformat} |
----
h4. Parameters



h5. Query Parameters
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |bookmark |Cursor used to fetch the next page of items | String | (x) |null |  |  ||page_size |Maximum number of items to include in a single page of the response. See documentation on &lt;a href&#x3D;&#39;/docs/getting-started/pagination/&#39;&gt;Pagination&lt;/a&gt; for more information. | Integer | (x) |25 |  |  ||catalog_id |Filter entities for a given catalog_id. If not given, all catalogs are considered. | String | (x) |null | /^\\d+$/ |  ||ad_account_id |Unique identifier of an ad account. | String | (x) |null | /^\\d+$/ |  |
----
h4. Responses

    	|| Status Code | {status:colour=Green|title=200|subtle=false} |
    	|| Message | Success |
    	|| Response Type | feeds_list_200_response |
    	|| Response Model | [feeds_list_200_response Model|#feeds_list_200_responseModelAnchor|Jump to model] |
    	|| Response Schema | {code:collapse=true}{
  "description" : "Success",
  "content" : {
    "application/json" : {
      "schema" : {
        "$ref" : "#/components/schemas/feeds_list_200_response"
      }
    }
  }
}{code} |
       


    	|| Status Code | {status:colour=Orange|title=400|subtle=false} |
    	|| Message | Invalid parameters. |
    	|| Response Type | Error |
    	|| Response Model | [Error Model|#ErrorModelAnchor|Jump to model] |
    	|| Response Schema | {code:collapse=true}{
  "description" : "Invalid parameters.",
  "content" : {
    "application/json" : {
      "schema" : {
        "$ref" : "#/components/schemas/Error"
      },
      "examples" : {
        "InvalidRequest" : {
          "value" : {
            "code" : 1,
            "message" : "Parameter 'page_size' was not numeric (was 3e)\""
          }
        }
      }
    }
  }
}{code} |
       


    	|| Status Code | {status:colour=Orange|title=401|subtle=false} |
    	|| Message | Unauthorized access. |
    	|| Response Type | Error |
    	|| Response Model | [Error Model|#ErrorModelAnchor|Jump to model] |
    	|| Response Schema | {code:collapse=true}{

h3. feeds/update
{panel:title=feeds/update|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#003b6f|titleBGColor=#003b6f|titleColor=#a6b8c7|bgColor=#ffffff}
    *Summary:* Update feed
    *Description:* Update a feed owned by the &quot;operation user_account&quot;.
- By default, the &quot;operation user_account&quot; is the token user_account.

Optional: Business Access: Specify an &lt;code&gt;ad_account_id&lt;/code&gt; (obtained via &lt;a href&#x3D;&#39;/docs/api/v5/#operation/ad_accounts/list&#39;&gt;List ad accounts&lt;/a&gt;) to use the owner of that ad_account as the &quot;operation user_account&quot;. In order to do this, the token user_account must have one of the following &lt;a href&#x3D;&quot;https://help.pinterest.com/en/business/article/share-and-manage-access-to-your-ad-accounts&quot;&gt;Business Access&lt;/a&gt; roles on the ad_account: Owner, Admin, Catalogs Manager.

For Retail partners, refer to &lt;a href&#x3D;&#39;https://help.pinterest.com/en/business/article/before-you-get-started-with-catalogs&#39;&gt;Before you get started with Catalogs&lt;/a&gt;. For Hotel parterns, refer to &lt;a href&#x3D;&#39;/docs/shopping/catalog/&#39;&gt;Pinterest API for shopping&lt;/a&gt;.

	|| HttpMethod | {status:colour=Yellow|title=patch|subtle=false} |
    || Protocol | {noformat:nopanel=true}https{noformat} |
    || Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}/catalogs/feeds/{feed_id}{noformat} |
    || Base Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}https://api.pinterest.com/v5{noformat} |
    || Produces | {noformat:nopanel=true}application/json {noformat} |
----
h4. Parameters
h5. Path Parameters
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |feed_id |Unique identifier of a feed | String | (/) |null | /^\\d+$/ |  |

h5. Body Parameter
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |FeedsUpdateRequest |Request object used to update a feed. | FeedsUpdateRequest | (/) | |  |  |


h5. Query Parameters
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |ad_account_id |Unique identifier of an ad account. | String | (x) |null | /^\\d+$/ |  |
----
h4. Responses

    	|| Status Code | {status:colour=Green|title=200|subtle=false} |
    	|| Message | Success |
    	|| Response Type | CatalogsFeed |
    	|| Response Model | [CatalogsFeed Model|#CatalogsFeedModelAnchor|Jump to model] |
    	|| Response Schema | {code:collapse=true}{
  "description" : "Success",
  "content" : {
    "application/json" : {
      "schema" : {
        "$ref" : "#/components/schemas/CatalogsFeed"
      }
    }
  }
}{code} |
       


    	|| Status Code | {status:colour=Orange|title=400|subtle=false} |
    	|| Message | Invalid feed parameters. |
    	|| Response Type | Error |
    	|| Response Model | [Error Model|#ErrorModelAnchor|Jump to model] |
    	|| Response Schema | {code:collapse=true}{
  "description" : "Invalid feed parameters.",
  "content" : {
    "application/json" : {
      "schema" : {
        "$ref" : "#/components/schemas/Error"
      },
      "examples" : {
        "InvalidRequest" : {
          "value" : {
            "code" : 1,
            "message" : "Invalid request: ..."
          }
        }
      }
    }
  }
}{code} |
       


    	|| Status Code | {status:colour=Orange|title=403|subtle=false} |
    	|| Message | Forbidden. Account not approved for feed mutations yet. |
    	|| Response Type | Error |
    	|| Response Model | [Error Model|#ErrorModelAnchor|Jump to model] |

h3. items/get
{panel:title=items/get|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#003b6f|titleBGColor=#003b6f|titleColor=#a6b8c7|bgColor=#ffffff}
    *Summary:* Get catalogs items
    *Description:* Get the items of the catalog owned by the &quot;operation user_account&quot;. &lt;a href&#x3D;&quot;/docs/shopping/catalog/#Update%20items%20in%20batch&quot; target&#x3D;&quot;_blank&quot;&gt;See detailed documentation here.&lt;/a&gt;
- By default, the &quot;operation user_account&quot; is the token user_account.

Optional: Business Access: Specify an &lt;code&gt;ad_account_id&lt;/code&gt; (obtained via &lt;a href&#x3D;&#39;/docs/api/v5/#operation/ad_accounts/list&#39;&gt;List ad accounts&lt;/a&gt;) to use the owner of that ad_account as the &quot;operation user_account&quot;. In order to do this, the token user_account must have one of the following &lt;a href&#x3D;&quot;https://help.pinterest.com/en/business/article/share-and-manage-access-to-your-ad-accounts&quot;&gt;Business Access&lt;/a&gt; roles on the ad_account: Owner, Admin, Catalogs Manager.

	|| HttpMethod | {status:colour=Yellow|title=get|subtle=false} |
    || Protocol | {noformat:nopanel=true}https{noformat} |
    || Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}/catalogs/items{noformat} |
    || Base Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}https://api.pinterest.com/v5{noformat} |
    || Produces | {noformat:nopanel=true}application/json {noformat} |
----
h4. Parameters



h5. Query Parameters
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |ad_account_id |Unique identifier of an ad account. | String | (x) |null | /^\\d+$/ |  ||country |Country for the Catalogs Items | String | (/) |null |  |  ||language |Language for the Catalogs Items | String | (/) |null |  |  ||item_ids |This parameter is deprecated. Use filters instead. | array[String] | (x) |null |  |  ||filters |Identifies items to be retrieved. This is a required parameter. | CatalogsItemsFilters | (x) |null |  |  |
----

    	|| Status Code | {status:colour=Green|title=200|subtle=false} |

      "schema" : {

      }
    }
  }
}{code} |

h3. itemsBatch/get
{panel:title=itemsBatch/get|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#003b6f|titleBGColor=#003b6f|titleColor=#a6b8c7|bgColor=#ffffff}
    *Summary:* Get catalogs item batch status
    *Description:* Get a single catalogs items batch owned by the &quot;operating user_account&quot;. &lt;a href&#x3D;&quot;/docs/shopping/catalog/#Update%20items%20in%20batch&quot; target&#x3D;&quot;_blank&quot;&gt;See detailed documentation here.&lt;/a&gt;
- By default, the &quot;operation user_account&quot; is the token user_account.

Optional: Business Access: Specify an &lt;code&gt;ad_account_id&lt;/code&gt; (obtained via &lt;a href&#x3D;&#39;/docs/api/v5/#operation/ad_accounts/list&#39;&gt;List ad accounts&lt;/a&gt;) to use the owner of that ad_account as the &quot;operation user_account&quot;. In order to do this, the token user_account must have one of the following &lt;a href&#x3D;&quot;https://help.pinterest.com/en/business/article/share-and-manage-access-to-your-ad-accounts&quot;&gt;Business Access&lt;/a&gt; roles on the ad_account: Owner, Admin, Catalogs Manager.

	|| HttpMethod | {status:colour=Yellow|title=get|subtle=false} |
    || Protocol | {noformat:nopanel=true}https{noformat} |
    || Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}/catalogs/items/batch/{batch_id}{noformat} |
    || Base Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}https://api.pinterest.com/v5{noformat} |
    || Produces | {noformat:nopanel=true}application/json {noformat} |

h3. itemsBatch/post
{panel:title=itemsBatch/post|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#003b6f|titleBGColor=#003b6f|titleColor=#a6b8c7|bgColor=#ffffff}
    *Summary:* Operate on item batch
    *Description:* This endpoint supports multiple operations on a set of one or more catalog items owned by the &quot;operation user_account&quot;. &lt;a href&#x3D;&quot;/docs/shopping/catalog/#Update%20items%20in%20batch&quot; target&#x3D;&quot;_blank&quot;&gt;See detailed documentation here.&lt;/a&gt;
- By default, the &quot;operation user_account&quot; is the token user_account.

Optional: Business Access: Specify an &lt;code&gt;ad_account_id&lt;/code&gt; (obtained via &lt;a href&#x3D;&#39;/docs/api/v5/#operation/ad_accounts/list&#39;&gt;List ad accounts&lt;/a&gt;) to use the owner of that ad_account as the &quot;operation user_account&quot;. In order to do this, the token user_account must have one of the following &lt;a href&#x3D;&quot;https://help.pinterest.com/en/business/article/share-and-manage-access-to-your-ad-accounts&quot;&gt;Business Access&lt;/a&gt; roles on the ad_account: Owner, Admin, Catalogs Manager.

	|| HttpMethod | {status:colour=Yellow|title=post|subtle=false} |
    || Protocol | {noformat:nopanel=true}https{noformat} |
    || Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}/catalogs/items/batch{noformat} |
    || Base Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}https://api.pinterest.com/v5{noformat} |
    || Produces | {noformat:nopanel=true}application/json {noformat} |
----

h3. itemsIssues/list
{panel:title=itemsIssues/list|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#003b6f|titleBGColor=#003b6f|titleColor=#a6b8c7|bgColor=#ffffff}
    *Summary:* List item issues for a given processing result
    *Description:* List item validation issues for a given feed processing result owned by the &quot;operation user_account&quot;. Up to 20 random samples of affected items are returned for each error and warning code. Please note that for now query parameters &#39;item_numbers&#39; and &#39;item_validation_issue&#39; cannot be used simultaneously until it is implemented in some release in the future.
- By default, the &quot;operation user_account&quot; is the token user_account.

Optional: Business Access: Specify an &lt;code&gt;ad_account_id&lt;/code&gt; (obtained via &lt;a href&#x3D;&#39;/docs/api/v5/#operation/ad_accounts/list&#39;&gt;List ad accounts&lt;/a&gt;) to use the owner of that ad_account as the &quot;operation user_account&quot;. In order to do this, the token user_account must have one of the following &lt;a href&#x3D;&quot;https://help.pinterest.com/en/business/article/share-and-manage-access-to-your-ad-accounts&quot;&gt;Business Access&lt;/a&gt; roles on the ad_account: Owner, Admin, Catalogs Manager.

&lt;a href&#x3D;&#39;/docs/shopping/catalog/&#39;&gt;Learn more&lt;/a&gt;

	|| HttpMethod | {status:colour=Yellow|title=get|subtle=false} |
    || Protocol | {noformat:nopanel=true}https{noformat} |
    || Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}/catalogs/processing_results/{processing_result_id}/item_issues{noformat} |
    || Base Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}https://api.pinterest.com/v5{noformat} |
    || Produces | {noformat:nopanel=true}application/json {noformat} |
----
h4. Parameters
h5. Path Parameters
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |processing_result_id |Unique identifier of a feed processing result. It can be acquired from the &quot;id&quot; field of the &quot;items&quot; array within the response of the [List processing results for a given feed\](https://developers.pinterest.com/docs/api/v5/#operation/feed_processing_results/list). | String | (/) |null | /^\\d+$/ |  |



h5. Query Parameters
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |bookmark |Cursor used to fetch the next page of items | String | (x) |null |  |  ||page_size |Maximum number of items to include in a single page of the response. See documentation on &lt;a href&#x3D;&#39;/docs/getting-started/pagination/&#39;&gt;Pagination&lt;/a&gt; for more information. | Integer | (x) |25 |  |  ||item_numbers |Item number based on order of appearance in the Catalogs Feed. For example, &#39;0&#39; refers to first item found in a feed that was downloaded from a &#39;location&#39; specified during feed creation. | array[Integer] | (x) |null |  |  ||item_validation_issue |Filter item validation issues that have a given type of item validation issue. | CatalogsItemValidationIssue | (x) |null |  |  ||ad_account_id |Unique identifier of an ad account. | String | (x) |null | /^\\d+$/ |  |
----
h4. Responses

    	|| Status Code | {status:colour=Green|title=200|subtle=false} |
    	|| Message | Success |
    	|| Response Type | items_issues_list_200_response |
    	|| Response Model | [items_issues_list_200_response Model|#items_issues_list_200_responseModelAnchor|Jump to model] |
    	|| Response Schema | {code:collapse=true}{
  "description" : "Success",
  "content" : {
    "application/json" : {
      "schema" : {
        "$ref" : "#/components/schemas/items_issues_list_200_response"
      }
    }
  }
}{code} |
       


    	|| Status Code | {status:colour=Orange|title=401|subtle=false} |
    	|| Message | Unauthorized access. |
    	|| Response Type | Error |
    	|| Response Model | [Error Model|#ErrorModelAnchor|Jump to model] |
    	|| Response Schema | {code:collapse=true}{
  "description" : "Unauthorized access.",
  "content" : {
    "application/json" : {
      "schema" : {
        "$ref" : "#/components/schemas/Error"
      },
      "examples" : {
        "UnauthorizedAccess" : {
          "value" : {
            "code" : 29,
            "message" : "You are not permitted to access that resource."
          }
        }
      }
    }
  }
}{code} |
       


    	|| Status Code | {status:colour=Orange|title=404|subtle=false} |
    	|| Message | Processing Result not found. |
    	|| Response Type | Error |
    	|| Response Model | [Error Model|#ErrorModelAnchor|Jump to model] |
    	|| Response Schema | {code:collapse=true}{
  "description" : "Processing Result not found.",
  "content" : {

          }

          }
        }

  }
}{code} |
       


    	|| Status Code | {status:colour=Red|title=0|subtle=false} |
    	|| Message | Unexpected error. |

{panel}



h3. productsByProductGroupFilter/list
{panel:title=productsByProductGroupFilter/list|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#003b6f|titleBGColor=#003b6f|titleColor=#a6b8c7|bgColor=#ffffff}
    *Summary:* List filtered products
    *Description:* List products Pins owned by the &quot;operation user_account&quot; that meet the criteria specified in the Catalogs Product Group Filter given in the request.
- This endpoint has been implemented in POST to allow for complex filters. This specific POST endpoint is designed to be idempotent.
- By default, the &quot;operation user_account&quot; is the token user_account.

Optional: Business Access: Specify an &lt;code&gt;ad_account_id&lt;/code&gt; (obtained via &lt;a href&#x3D;&#39;/docs/api/v5/#operation/ad_accounts/list&#39;&gt;List ad accounts&lt;/a&gt;) to use the owner of that ad_account as the &quot;operation user_account&quot;. In order to do this, the token user_account must have one of the following &lt;a href&#x3D;&quot;https://help.pinterest.com/en/business/article/share-and-manage-access-to-your-ad-accounts&quot;&gt;Business Access&lt;/a&gt; roles on the ad_account: Owner, Admin, Catalogs Manager.

&lt;a href&#x3D;&#39;/docs/shopping/catalog/&#39;&gt;Learn more&lt;/a&gt;

	|| HttpMethod | {status:colour=Yellow|title=post|subtle=false} |
    || Protocol | {noformat:nopanel=true}https{noformat} |
    || Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}/catalogs/products/get_by_product_group_filters{noformat} |
    || Base Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}https://api.pinterest.com/v5{noformat} |
    || Produces | {noformat:nopanel=true}application/json {noformat} |
----
h4. Parameters

h5. Body Parameter
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |CatalogsListProductsByFilterRequest |Object holding a group of filters for a catalog product group | CatalogsListProductsByFilterRequest | (/) | |  |  |


h5. Query Parameters
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |bookmark |Cursor used to fetch the next page of items | String | (x) |null |  |  ||page_size |Maximum number of items to include in a single page of the response. See documentation on &lt;a href&#x3D;&#39;/docs/getting-started/pagination/&#39;&gt;Pagination&lt;/a&gt; for more information. | Integer | (x) |25 |  |  ||ad_account_id |Unique identifier of an ad account. | String | (x) |null | /^\\d+$/ |  |

h3. events/create
{panel:title=events/create|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#003b6f|titleBGColor=#003b6f|titleColor=#a6b8c7|bgColor=#ffffff}
    *Summary:* Send conversions
    *Description:* The Pinterest API offers advertisers a way to send Pinterest their conversion information (including web conversions, in-app conversions, or even offline conversions) based on their &lt;code&gt;ad_account_id&lt;/code&gt;. The request body should be a JSON object.
- This endpoint requires an &lt;code&gt;access_token&lt;/code&gt; be generated through Ads Manager. Review the &lt;a href&#x3D;&quot;/docs/conversions/conversions/&quot;&gt;Conversions Guide&lt;/a&gt; for more details.
- The token&#39;s &lt;code&gt;user_account&lt;/code&gt; must either be the Owner of the specified ad account, or have one of the necessary roles granted to them via &lt;a href&#x3D;&quot;https://help.pinterest.com/en/business/article/share-and-manage-access-to-your-ad-accounts&quot;&gt;Business Access&lt;/a&gt;: Admin, Analyst, Audience, Campaign. (Note that the token can be used across multiple ad accounts under an user ID.)
- This endpoint has a rate limit of 5,000 calls per minute per ad account.
- If the merchant is submitting this information using both Pinterest conversion tags and the Pinterest API, Pinterest will remove duplicate information before reporting. (Note that events that took place offline cannot be deduplicated.)

	|| HttpMethod | {status:colour=Yellow|title=post|subtle=false} |
    || Protocol | {noformat:nopanel=true}https{noformat} |
    || Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}/ad_accounts/{ad_account_id}/events{noformat} |
    || Base Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}https://api.pinterest.com/v5{noformat} |
    || Produces | {noformat:nopanel=true}application/json {noformat} |
----
h4. Parameters
h5. Path Parameters
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |ad_account_id |Unique identifier of an ad account. | String | (/) |null | /^\\d+$/ |  |

h5. Body Parameter
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |ConversionEvents |Conversion events. | ConversionEvents | (/) | |  |  |


h5. Query Parameters
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |test |Include query param ?test&#x3D;true to mark the request as a test request. The events will not be recorded but the API will still return the same response messages. Use this mode to verify your requests are working and your events are constructed correctly.
Warning: If you use this query parameter, be certain that it is off (set to false or deleted) before sending a legitimate (non-testing) request. | Boolean | (x) |null |  |  |
----

h3. conversionTags/create
{panel:title=conversionTags/create|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#003b6f|titleBGColor=#003b6f|titleColor=#a6b8c7|bgColor=#ffffff}
    *Summary:* Create conversion tag
    *Description:* Create a conversion tag, also known as &lt;a href&#x3D;&quot;https://help.pinterest.com/en/business/article/set-up-the-pinterest-tag&quot; target&#x3D;&quot;_blank&quot;&gt;Pinterest tag&lt;/a&gt;, with the option to enable enhanced match.&lt;p/&gt;
The Pinterest Tag tracks actions people take on the ad account’s website after they view the ad account&#39;s ad on Pinterest. The advertiser needs to customize this tag to track conversions.&lt;p/&gt;
For more information, see:&lt;p/&gt;
&lt;a class&#x3D;&quot;reference external&quot; href&#x3D;&quot;https://help.pinterest.com/en/business/article/set-up-the-pinterest-tag&quot;&gt;Set up the Pinterest tag&lt;/a&gt;&lt;p/&gt;
&lt;a class&#x3D;&quot;reference external&quot; href&#x3D;&quot;https://developers.pinterest.com/docs/conversions/pinterest-tag/&quot;&gt;Pinterest Tag&lt;/a&gt;&lt;p/&gt;
&lt;a class&#x3D;&quot;reference external&quot; href&#x3D;&quot;https://developers.pinterest.com/docs/conversions/enhanced-match/&quot;&gt;Enhanced match&lt;/a&gt;

	|| HttpMethod | {status:colour=Yellow|title=post|subtle=false} |
    || Protocol | {noformat:nopanel=true}https{noformat} |
    || Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}/ad_accounts/{ad_account_id}/conversion_tags{noformat} |
    || Base Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}https://api.pinterest.com/v5{noformat} |
    || Produces | {noformat:nopanel=true}application/json {noformat} |

h3. customerLists/create
{panel:title=customerLists/create|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#003b6f|titleBGColor=#003b6f|titleColor=#a6b8c7|bgColor=#ffffff}
    *Summary:* Create customer lists
    *Description:* &lt;p&gt;Create a customer list from your records(hashed or plain-text email addresses, or hashed MAIDs or IDFAs).&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p&gt;A customer list is one of the four types of Pinterest audiences: for more information, see &lt;a href&#x3D;&quot;https://help.pinterest.com/en/business/article/audience-targeting&quot; target&#x3D;&quot;_blank&quot;&gt;Audience targeting&lt;/a&gt;
or the &lt;a href&#x3D;&quot;/docs/ads/targeting/#Audiences&quot; target&#x3D;&quot;_blank&quot;&gt;Audiences&lt;/a&gt; section of the ads management guide.&lt;p/&gt;
&lt;p&gt;&lt;b&gt;Please review our &lt;u&gt;&lt;a href&#x3D;&quot;https://help.pinterest.com/en/business/article/audience-targeting#section-13341&quot; target&#x3D;&quot;_blank&quot;&gt;requirements&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/u&gt; for what type of information is allowed when uploading a customer list.&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p&gt;When you create a customer list, the system scans the list for existing Pinterest accounts;
the list must include at least 100 Pinterest accounts. Your original list will be deleted when the matching process
is complete. The filtered list – containing only the Pinterest accounts that were included in your starting
list – is what will be used to create the audience.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p&gt;Note that once you have created your customer list, you must convert it into an audience (of the “CUSTOMER_LIST” type)
using the &lt;a href&#x3D;&quot;#operation/create_audience_handler&quot;&gt;create audience endpoint&lt;/a&gt; before it can be used.&lt;/p&gt;

	|| HttpMethod | {status:colour=Yellow|title=post|subtle=false} |
    || Protocol | {noformat:nopanel=true}https{noformat} |
    || Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}/ad_accounts/{ad_account_id}/customer_lists{noformat} |
    || Base Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}https://api.pinterest.com/v5{noformat} |
    || Produces | {noformat:nopanel=true}application/json {noformat} |
----
h4. Parameters
h5. Path Parameters
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |ad_account_id |Unique identifier of an ad account. | String | (/) |null | /^\\d+$/ |  |

h5. Body Parameter
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |CustomerListRequest |Parameters to get Customer lists info | CustomerListRequest | (/) | |  |  |


----
h4. Responses

    	|| Status Code | {status:colour=Green|title=200|subtle=false} |
    	|| Message | Success |
    	|| Response Type | CustomerList |
    	|| Response Model | [CustomerList Model|#CustomerListModelAnchor|Jump to model] |
    	|| Response Schema | {code:collapse=true}{
  "description" : "Success",
  "content" : {
    "application/json" : {
      "schema" : {
        "$ref" : "#/components/schemas/CustomerList"
      }
    }
  }
}{code} |
       


    	|| Status Code | {status:colour=Red|title=0|subtle=false} |
    	|| Message | Unexpected error |
    	|| Response Type | Error |
    	|| Response Model | [Error Model|#ErrorModelAnchor|Jump to model] |
    	|| Response Schema | {code:collapse=true}{
  "description" : "Unexpected error",
  "content" : {
    "application/json" : {
      "schema" : {
        "$ref" : "#/components/schemas/Error"
      }
    }
  }
}{code} |

&lt;p&gt;(Customer lists are a type of audience.) For more information, see
&lt;a href&#x3D;&quot;https://help.pinterest.com/en/business/article/audience-targeting&quot; target&#x3D;&quot;_blank&quot;&gt;Audience targeting&lt;/a&gt;

by ID. Note that higher-value IDs are associated with more-recently added
items. | String | (x) |null |  | [ASCENDING, DESCENDING] ||bookmark |Cursor used to fetch the next page of items | String | (x) |null |  |  |

h3. customerLists/update
{panel:title=customerLists/update|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#003b6f|titleBGColor=#003b6f|titleColor=#a6b8c7|bgColor=#ffffff}
    *Summary:* Update customer list
    *Description:* &lt;p&gt;Append or remove records to/from an existing customer list. (A customer list is one of the four types of Pinterest audiences.)&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p&gt;When you add records to an existing customer list, the system scans the additions for existing Pinterest
accounts; those are the records that will be added to your “CUSTOMER_LIST” audience. Your original list of records
to add will be deleted when the matching process is complete.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p&gt;For more information, see &lt;a href&#x3D;&quot;https://help.pinterest.com/en/business/article/audience-targeting&quot; target&#x3D;&quot;_blank&quot;&gt;Audience targeting&lt;/a&gt;
or the &lt;a href&#x3D;&quot;/docs/ads/targeting/#Audiences&quot; target&#x3D;&quot;_blank&quot;&gt;Audiences&lt;/a&gt;
section of the ads management guide.&lt;/p&gt;

	|| HttpMethod | {status:colour=Yellow|title=patch|subtle=false} |
    || Protocol | {noformat:nopanel=true}https{noformat} |
    || Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}/ad_accounts/{ad_account_id}/customer_lists/{customer_list_id}{noformat} |

        |CustomerListUpdateRequest | | CustomerListUpdateRequest | (/) | |  |  |

h3. integrationsCommerce/post
{panel:title=integrationsCommerce/post|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#003b6f|titleBGColor=#003b6f|titleColor=#a6b8c7|bgColor=#ffffff}
    *Summary:* Create commerce integration
    *Description:* Create commerce integration metadata to link an external business ID with a Pinterest merchant &amp; ad account.
Note: If you&#39;re interested in joining the beta, please reach out to your Pinterest account manager.

	|| HttpMethod | {status:colour=Yellow|title=post|subtle=false} |
    || Protocol | {noformat:nopanel=true}https{noformat} |
    || Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}/integrations/commerce{noformat} |
    || Base Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}https://api.pinterest.com/v5{noformat} |

h3. keywords/create
{panel:title=keywords/create|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#003b6f|titleBGColor=#003b6f|titleColor=#a6b8c7|bgColor=#ffffff}
    *Summary:* Create keywords
    *Description:* &lt;p&gt;Create keywords for following entity types(advertiser, campaign, ad group or ad).&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;For more information, see &lt;a target&#x3D;&quot;_blank&quot; href&#x3D;&quot;https://help.pinterest.com/en/business/article/keyword-targeting&quot;&gt;Keyword targeting&lt;/a&gt;.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p&gt;&lt;b&gt;Notes:&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;ul style&#x3D;&quot;list-style-type: square;&quot;&gt; &lt;li&gt;Advertisers and campaigns can only be assigned keywords with excluding (&#39;_NEGATIVE&#39;).&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;All keyword match types are available for ad groups.&lt;/li&gt; &lt;/ul&gt; &lt;p&gt;For more information on match types, see &lt;a  target&#x3D;&quot;_blank&quot; href&#x3D;&quot;/docs/ads/targeting/#Match%20type%20and%20targeting%20level&quot;&gt;match type enums&lt;/a&gt;.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p&gt;&lt;b&gt;Returns:&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;ul style&#x3D;&quot;list-style-type: square;&quot;&gt; &lt;li&gt;&lt;p&gt;A successful call returns an object containing an array of new keyword objects and an empty &amp;quot;errors&amp;quot; object array.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;&lt;p&gt;An unsuccessful call returns an empty keywords array, and, instead, inserts the entire object with nulled/negated properties into the &amp;quot;errors&amp;quot; object array:&lt;/p&gt; &lt;pre class&#x3D;&quot;last literal-block&quot;&gt; \{ &quot;keywords&quot;: [\], &quot;errors&quot;: [ \{ &quot;data&quot;: \{ &quot;archived&quot;: null, &quot;match_type&quot;: &quot;EXACT&quot;, &quot;parent_type&quot;: null, &quot;value&quot;: &quot;foobar&quot;, &quot;parent_id&quot;: null, &quot;type&quot;: &quot;keyword&quot;, &quot;id&quot;: null \}, &quot;error_messages&quot;: [ &quot;Advertisers and Campaigns only accept excluded targeting attributes.&quot; \] \} \} &lt;/pre&gt;&lt;/li&gt; &lt;/ul&gt;
&lt;p&gt;&lt;b&gt;Rate limit&lt;/b&gt;: &lt;a href&#x3D;&quot;/docs/redoc/#tag/Rate-Limits&quot;&gt;WRITE&lt;/a&gt;.&lt;/p&gt;

	|| HttpMethod | {status:colour=Yellow|title=post|subtle=false} |
    || Protocol | {noformat:nopanel=true}https{noformat} |
    || Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}/ad_accounts/{ad_account_id}/keywords{noformat} |
    || Base Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}https://api.pinterest.com/v5{noformat} |
    || Produces | {noformat:nopanel=true}application/json {noformat} |
----
h4. Parameters
h5. Path Parameters
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |ad_account_id |Unique identifier of an ad account. | String | (/) |null | /^\\d+$/ |  |

h5. Body Parameter
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |KeywordsRequest | | KeywordsRequest | (/) | |  |  |


----
h4. Responses

    	|| Status Code | {status:colour=Green|title=200|subtle=false} |
    	|| Message | Success |
    	|| Response Type | KeywordsResponse |
    	|| Response Model | [KeywordsResponse Model|#KeywordsResponseModelAnchor|Jump to model] |
    	|| Response Schema | {code:collapse=true}{
  "description" : "Success",
  "content" : {
    "application/json" : {
      "schema" : {
        "$ref" : "#/components/schemas/KeywordsResponse"
      }
    }
  }
}{code} |
       


    	|| Status Code | {status:colour=Red|title=0|subtle=false} |
    	|| Message | Unexpected error |
    	|| Response Type | Error |
    	|| Response Model | [Error Model|#ErrorModelAnchor|Jump to model] |
    	|| Response Schema | {code:collapse=true}{
  "description" : "Unexpected error",
  "content" : {

      "schema" : {
        "$ref" : "#/components/schemas/Error"
      }
    }
  }

{panel}



h3. keywords/get
{panel:title=keywords/get|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#003b6f|titleBGColor=#003b6f|titleColor=#a6b8c7|bgColor=#ffffff}
    *Summary:* Get keywords
    *Description:* &lt;p&gt;Get a list of keywords based on the filters provided. If no filter is provided, it will default to the ad_account_id filter, which means it will only return keywords that specifically have parent_id set to the ad_account_id. Note: Keywords can have ad_account_ids, campaign_ids, and ad_group_ids set as their parent_ids. Keywords created through Ads Manager will have their parent_id set to an ad_group_id, not ad_account_id.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p&gt;For more information, see &lt;a target&#x3D;&quot;_blank&quot; href&#x3D;&quot;https://help.pinterest.com/en/business/article/keyword-targeting&quot;&gt;Keyword targeting&lt;/a&gt;.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p&gt;&lt;b&gt;Notes:&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;ul style&#x3D;&quot;list-style-type: square;&quot;&gt; &lt;li&gt;Advertisers and campaigns can only be assigned keywords with excluding (&#39;_NEGATIVE&#39;).&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;All keyword match types are available for ad groups.&lt;/li&gt; &lt;/ul&gt; &lt;p&gt;For more information on match types, see &lt;a target&#x3D;&quot;_blank&quot; href&#x3D;&quot;/docs/ads/targeting/#Match%20type%20and%20targeting%20level&quot;&gt;match type enums&lt;/a&gt;.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p&gt;&lt;b&gt;Returns:&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;ul style&#x3D;&quot;list-style-type: square;&quot;&gt; &lt;li&gt;&lt;p&gt;A successful call returns an object containing an array of new keyword objects and an empty &amp;quot;errors&amp;quot; object array.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;&lt;p&gt;An unsuccessful call returns an empty keywords array, and, instead, inserts the entire object with nulled/negated properties into the &amp;quot;errors&amp;quot; object array:&lt;/p&gt; &lt;pre class&#x3D;&quot;last literal-block&quot;&gt; \{ &quot;keywords&quot;: [\], &quot;errors&quot;: [ \{ &quot;data&quot;: \{ &quot;archived&quot;: null, &quot;match_type&quot;: &quot;EXACT&quot;, &quot;parent_type&quot;: null, &quot;value&quot;: &quot;foobar&quot;, &quot;parent_id&quot;: null, &quot;type&quot;: &quot;keyword&quot;, &quot;id&quot;: null \}, &quot;error_messages&quot;: [ &quot;Advertisers and Campaigns only accept excluded targeting attributes.&quot; \] \} \} &lt;/pre&gt;&lt;/li&gt; &lt;/ul&gt;

	|| HttpMethod | {status:colour=Yellow|title=get|subtle=false} |
    || Protocol | {noformat:nopanel=true}https{noformat} |
    || Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}/ad_accounts/{ad_account_id}/keywords{noformat} |
    || Base Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}https://api.pinterest.com/v5{noformat} |
    || Produces | {noformat:nopanel=true}application/json {noformat} |
----
h4. Parameters
h5. Path Parameters
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |ad_account_id |Unique identifier of an ad account. | String | (/) |null | /^\\d+$/ |  |



h5. Query Parameters
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |campaign_id |Campaign Id to use to filter the results. | String | (x) |null | /^\\d+$/ |  ||ad_group_id |Ad group Id. | String | (x) |null | /^\\d+$/ |  ||match_types |Keyword &lt;a target&#x3D;&quot;_blank&quot; href&#x3D;&quot;/docs/ads/targeting/#Match%20type%20and%20targeting%20level&quot;&gt;match type&lt;/a&gt; | array[MatchType] | (x) |null |  |  ||page_size |Maximum number of items to include in a single page of the response. See documentation on &lt;a href&#x3D;&#39;/docs/getting-started/pagination/&#39;&gt;Pagination&lt;/a&gt; for more information. | Integer | (x) |25 |  |  ||bookmark |Cursor used to fetch the next page of items | String | (x) |null |  |  |
----
h4. Responses

    	|| Status Code | {status:colour=Green|title=200|subtle=false} |
    	|| Message | Success |
    	|| Response Type | keywords_get_200_response |
    	|| Response Model | [keywords_get_200_response Model|#keywords_get_200_responseModelAnchor|Jump to model] |
    	|| Response Schema | {code:collapse=true}{
  "description" : "Success",
  "content" : {
    "application/json" : {
      "schema" : {
        "$ref" : "#/components/schemas/keywords_get_200_response"
      }
    }
  }
}{code} |
       


    	|| Status Code | {status:colour=Red|title=0|subtle=false} |
    	|| Message | Unexpected error |
    	|| Response Type | Error |
    	|| Response Model | [Error Model|#ErrorModelAnchor|Jump to model] |
    	|| Response Schema | {code:collapse=true}{
  "description" : "Unexpected error",
  "content" : {
    "application/json" : {
      "schema" : {
        "$ref" : "#/components/schemas/Error"
      }
    }
  }

h3. keywords/update

    *Summary:* Update keywords
    *Description:* &lt;p&gt;Update one or more keywords&#39; bid and archived fields.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;Archiving a keyword effectively deletes it - keywords no longer receive metrics and no longer visible within the parent entity&#39;s keywords list.&lt;/p&gt;

	|| HttpMethod | {status:colour=Yellow|title=patch|subtle=false} |
    || Protocol | {noformat:nopanel=true}https{noformat} |

h3. trendingKeywords/list
{panel:title=trendingKeywords/list|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#003b6f|titleBGColor=#003b6f|titleColor=#a6b8c7|bgColor=#ffffff}
    *Summary:* List trending keywords
    *Description:* &lt;p&gt;Get the top trending search keywords among the Pinterest user audience.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p&gt;Trending keywords can be used to inform ad targeting, budget strategy, and creative decisions about which products and Pins will resonate with your audience.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p&gt;Geographic, demographic and interest-based filters are available to narrow down to the top trends among a specific audience. Multiple trend types are supported that can be used to identify newly-popular, evergreen or seasonal keywords.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p&gt;For an interactive way to explore this data, please visit &lt;a href&#x3D;&quot;https://trends.pinterest.com&quot;&gt;trends.pinterest.com&lt;/a&gt;.

	|| HttpMethod | {status:colour=Yellow|title=get|subtle=false} |
    || Protocol | {noformat:nopanel=true}https{noformat} |
    || Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}/trends/keywords/{region}/top/{trend_type}{noformat} |
    || Base Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}https://api.pinterest.com/v5{noformat} |
    || Produces | {noformat:nopanel=true}application/json {noformat} |
----
h4. Parameters
h5. Path Parameters
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |region |The geographic region of interest. Only top trends within the specified region will be returned.&lt;br /&gt;
The &#x60;region&#x60; parameter is formatted as ISO 3166-2 country codes delimited by &#x60;+&#x60;, corresponding to the following geographic areas:
- &#x60;US&#x60; - United States
- &#x60;CA&#x60; - Canada
- &#x60;DE&#x60; - Germany
- &#x60;FR&#x60; - France
- &#x60;ES&#x60; - Spain
- &#x60;IT&#x60; - Italy
- &#x60;DE+AT+CH&#x60; - Germanic countries
- &#x60;GB+IE&#x60; - Great Britain &amp; Ireland
- &#x60;IT+ES+PT+GR+MT&#x60; - Southern Europe
- &#x60;PL+RO+HU+SK+CZ&#x60; - Eastern Europe
- &#x60;SE+DK+FI+NO&#x60; - Nordic countries
- &#x60;NL+BE+LU&#x60; - Benelux
- &#x60;AR&#x60; - Argentina
- &#x60;BR&#x60; - Brazil
- &#x60;CO&#x60; - Colombia
- &#x60;MX&#x60; - Mexico
- &#x60;MX+AR+CO+CL&#x60; - Hispanic LatAm
- &#x60;AU+NZ&#x60; - Australasia | TrendsSupportedRegion | (/) |null |  |  ||trend_type |The methodology used to rank how trendy a keyword is.
- &#x60;growing&#x60; trends have high upward growth in search volume over the last quarter
- &#x60;monthly&#x60; trends have high search volume in the last month
- &#x60;yearly&#x60; trends have high search volume in the last year
- &#x60;seasonal&#x60; trends have high upward growth in search volume over the last month and exhibit a seasonal recurring pattern (typically annual) | TrendType | (/) |null |  |  |



h5. Query Parameters
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |interests |If set, filters the results to trends associated with the specified interests.&lt;br /&gt;
If unset, trends for all interests will be returned.&lt;br /&gt;
The list of supported interests is:
- &#x60;animals&#x60; - Animals
- &#x60;architecture&#x60; - Architecture
- &#x60;art&#x60; - Art
- &#x60;beauty&#x60; - Beauty
- &#x60;childrens_fashion&#x60; - Children&#39;s Fashion
- &#x60;design&#x60; - Design
- &#x60;diy_and_crafts&#x60; - DIY &amp; Crafts
- &#x60;education&#x60; - Education
- &#x60;electronics&#x60; - Electronics
- &#x60;entertainment&#x60; - Entertainment
- &#x60;event_planning&#x60; - Event Planning
- &#x60;finance&#x60; - Finance
- &#x60;food_and_drinks&#x60; - Food &amp; Drink
- &#x60;gardening&#x60; - Gardening
- &#x60;health&#x60; - Health
- &#x60;home_decor&#x60; - Home Decor
- &#x60;mens_fashion&#x60; - Men&#39;s Fashion
- &#x60;parenting&#x60; - Parenting
- &#x60;quotes&#x60; - Quotes
- &#x60;sport&#x60; - Sports
- &#x60;travel&#x60; - Travel
- &#x60;vehicles&#x60; - Vehicles
- &#x60;wedding&#x60; - Wedding
- &#x60;womens_fashion&#x60; - Women&#39;s Fashion | array[String] | (x) |null |  |  ||genders |If set, filters the results to trends among users who identify with the specified gender(s).&lt;br /&gt;
If unset, trends among all genders will be returned.&lt;br /&gt;
The &#x60;unknown&#x60; group includes users with unspecified or customized gender profile settings. | array[String] | (x) |null |  |  ||ages |If set, filters the results to trends among users in the specified age range(s).&lt;br /&gt;
If unset, trends among all age groups will be returned. | array[String] | (x) |null |  |  ||normalize_against_group |Governs how the resulting time series data will be normalized to a [0-100\] scale.&lt;br /&gt;
By default (&#x60;false&#x60;), the data will be normalized independently for each keyword.  The peak search volume observation in *each* keyword&#39;s time series will be represented by the value 100.  This is ideal for analyzing when an individual keyword is expected to peak in interest.&lt;br /&gt;
If set to &#x60;true&#x60;, the data will be normalized as a group.  The peak search volume observation across *all* keywords in the response will be represented by the value 100, and all other values scaled accordingly.  Use this option when you wish to compare relative search volume between multiple keywords. | Boolean | (x) |false |  |  ||limit |The maximum number of trending keywords that will be returned. Keywords are returned in trend-ranked order, so a &#x60;limit&#x60; of 50 will return the top 50 trends. | Integer | (x) |50 |  |  |
----
h4. Responses

    	|| Status Code | {status:colour=Green|title=200|subtle=false} |
    	|| Message | Success |
    	|| Response Type | TrendingKeywordsResponse |
    	|| Response Model | [TrendingKeywordsResponse Model|#TrendingKeywordsResponseModelAnchor|Jump to model] |
    	|| Response Schema | {code:collapse=true}{
  "description" : "Success",
  "content" : {
    "application/json" : {
      "schema" : {
        "$ref" : "#/components/schemas/TrendingKeywordsResponse"
      }
    }
  }
}{code} |
       


    	|| Status Code | {status:colour=Orange|title=400|subtle=false} |
    	|| Message | Invalid trending keywords request parameters |
    	|| Response Type | Error |
    	|| Response Model | [Error Model|#ErrorModelAnchor|Jump to model] |
    	|| Response Schema | {code:collapse=true}{
  "description" : "Invalid trending keywords request parameters",
  "content" : {
    "application/json" : {
      "schema" : {
        "$ref" : "#/components/schemas/Error"
      },
      "example" : {
        "code" : 400,
        "message" : "Invalid trending keywords request parameters"
      }
    }
  }
}{code} |
       


    	|| Status Code | {status:colour=Red|title=0|subtle=false} |
    	|| Message | Unexpected error |
    	|| Response Type | Error |
    	|| Response Model | [Error Model|#ErrorModelAnchor|Jump to model] |
    	|| Response Schema | {code:collapse=true}{
  "description" : "Unexpected error",
  "content" : {

h3. adAccountsSubscriptions/post

    *Description:* Create a lead ads webhook subscription.
- Only requests for the OWNER or ADMIN of the ad_account will be allowed.
- Advertisers can set up multiple integrations using ad_account_id + lead_form_id but only one integration per unique records.

h3. leadFormTest/create
{panel:title=leadFormTest/create|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#003b6f|titleBGColor=#003b6f|titleColor=#a6b8c7|bgColor=#ffffff}

    *Description:* Create lead form test data based on the list of answers provided as part of the body.
- List of answers should follow the questions creation order.

h3. media/create
{panel:title=media/create|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#003b6f|titleBGColor=#003b6f|titleColor=#a6b8c7|bgColor=#ffffff}
    *Summary:* Register media upload
    *Description:* Register your intent to upload media

The response includes all of the information needed to upload the media
to Pinterest.

To upload the media, make an HTTP POST request (using &lt;tt&gt;curl&lt;/tt&gt;, for
example) to &lt;tt&gt;upload_url&lt;/tt&gt; using the &lt;tt&gt;Content-Type&lt;/tt&gt; header
value. Send the media file&#39;s contents as the request&#39;s &lt;tt&gt;file&lt;/tt&gt;
parameter and also include all of the parameters from
&lt;tt&gt;upload_parameters&lt;/tt&gt;.

&lt;strong&gt;&lt;a href&#x3D;&#39;/docs/content/content-creation/#Creating%20video%20Pins&#39;&gt;Learn more&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/strong&gt; about video Pin creation.

	|| HttpMethod | {status:colour=Yellow|title=post|subtle=false} |
    || Protocol | {noformat:nopanel=true}https{noformat} |
    || Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}/media{noformat} |
    || Base Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}https://api.pinterest.com/v5{noformat} |
    || Produces | {noformat:nopanel=true}application/json {noformat} |
----
h4. Parameters

        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |MediaUploadRequest |Create a media upload request | MediaUploadRequest | (/) | |  |  |

h3. oauth/token
{panel:title=oauth/token|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#003b6f|titleBGColor=#003b6f|titleColor=#a6b8c7|bgColor=#ffffff}
    *Summary:* Generate OAuth access token
    *Description:* Generate an OAuth access token by using an authorization code or a refresh token.

IMPORTANT: You need to start the OAuth flow via www.pinterest.com/oauth before calling this endpoint (or have an existing refresh token).

See &lt;a href&#x3D;&#39;/docs/getting-started/authentication/&#39;&gt;Authentication&lt;/a&gt; for more.

&lt;strong&gt;Parameter &lt;i&gt;refresh_on&lt;/i&gt; and its corresponding response type &lt;i&gt;everlasting_refresh&lt;/i&gt; are now available to all apps\! Later this year, continuous refresh will become the default behavior (ie you will no longer need to send this parameter). &lt;a href&#x3D;&#39;/docs/new/about-beta-access/&#39;&gt;Learn more&lt;/a&gt;.&lt;/strong&gt;

	|| HttpMethod | {status:colour=Yellow|title=post|subtle=false} |

h3. pins/analytics
{panel:title=pins/analytics|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#003b6f|titleBGColor=#003b6f|titleColor=#a6b8c7|bgColor=#ffffff}
    *Summary:* Get Pin analytics
    *Description:* Get analytics for a Pin owned by the &quot;operation user_account&quot; - or on a group board that has been shared with this account.
- By default, the &quot;operation user_account&quot; is the token user_account.

Optional: Business Access: Specify an &lt;code&gt;ad_account_id&lt;/code&gt; (obtained via &lt;a href&#x3D;&quot;https://developers.pinterest.com/docs/api/v5/#operation/ad_accounts/list&quot;&gt;List ad accounts&lt;/a&gt;) to use the owner of that ad_account as the &quot;operation user_account&quot;. In order to do this, the token user_account must have one of the following &lt;a href&#x3D;&quot;https://help.pinterest.com/en/business/article/share-and-manage-access-to-your-ad-accounts&quot;&gt;Business Access&lt;/a&gt; roles on the ad_account:

- For Pins on public or protected boards: Admin, Analyst.
- For Pins on secret boards: Admin.

If Pin was created before &lt;code&gt;2023-03-20&lt;/code&gt; lifetime metrics will only be available for Video and Idea Pin formats. Lifetime metrics are available for all Pin formats since then.

	|| HttpMethod | {status:colour=Yellow|title=get|subtle=false} |
    || Protocol | {noformat:nopanel=true}https{noformat} |
    || Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}/pins/{pin_id}/analytics{noformat} |
    || Base Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}https://api.pinterest.com/v5{noformat} |
    || Produces | {noformat:nopanel=true}application/json {noformat} |
----
h4. Parameters
h5. Path Parameters
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |pin_id |Unique identifier of a Pin. | String | (/) |null |  |  |



h5. Query Parameters
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |start_date |Metric report start date (UTC). Format: YYYY-MM-DD. Cannot be more than 90 days back from today. | date | (/) |null |  |  ||end_date |Metric report end date (UTC). Format: YYYY-MM-DD. Cannot be more than 90 days past start_date. | date | (/) |null |  |  ||app_types |Apps or devices to get data for, default is all. | String | (x) |ALL |  | [ALL, MOBILE, TABLET, WEB] ||metric_types |Pin metric types to get data for, default is all. | array[pins_analytics_metric_types_parameter_inner] | (/) |null |  |  ||split_field |How to split the data into groups. Not including this param means data won&#39;t be split. | String | (x) |NO_SPLIT |  | [NO_SPLIT, APP_TYPE] ||ad_account_id |Unique identifier of an ad account. | String | (x) |null | /^\\d+$/ |  |
----
h4. Responses

    	|| Status Code | {status:colour=Green|title=200|subtle=false} |
    	|| Message | response |
    	|| Response Type | map[String, PinAnalyticsMetricsResponse] |
    	|| Response Model | [map[String, PinAnalyticsMetricsResponse] Model|#map[String, PinAnalyticsMetricsResponse]ModelAnchor|Jump to model] |
    	|| Response Schema | {code:collapse=true}{
  "description" : "response",
  "content" : {
    "application/json" : {
      "schema" : {
        "$ref" : "#/components/schemas/PinAnalyticsResponse"
      }
    }
  }
}{code} |
       


    	|| Status Code | {status:colour=Orange|title=400|subtle=false} |
    	|| Message | Invalid pins analytics parameters. |
    	|| Response Type | Error |
    	|| Response Model | [Error Model|#ErrorModelAnchor|Jump to model] |

      },
      "example" : {
        "code" : 400,
        "message" : "Invalid pins analytics parameters."
      }
    }
