{panel}



h3. pins/create
{panel:title=pins/create|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#003b6f|titleBGColor=#003b6f|titleColor=#a6b8c7|bgColor=#ffffff}
    *Summary:* Create Pin
    *Description:* Create a Pin on a board or board section owned by the &quot;operation user_account&quot;.

Note: If the current &quot;operation user_account&quot; (defined by the access token) has access to another user&#39;s Ad Accounts via Pinterest Business Access, you can modify your request to make use of the current operation_user_account&#39;s permissions to those Ad Accounts by including the ad_account_id in the path parameters for the request (e.g. .../?ad_account_id&#x3D;12345&amp;...).

- This function is intended solely for publishing new content created by the user. If you are interested in saving content created by others to your Pinterest boards, sometimes called &#39;curated content&#39;, please use our &lt;a href&#x3D;&#39;/docs/add-ons/save-button&#39;&gt;Save button&lt;/a&gt; instead. For more tips on creating fresh content for Pinterest, review our &lt;a href&#x3D;&#39;/docs/content/content-creation/&#39;&gt;Content App Solutions Guide&lt;/a&gt;.

&lt;strong&gt;&lt;a href&#x3D;&#39;/docs/content/content-creation/#Creating%20video%20Pins&#39;&gt;Learn more&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/strong&gt; about video Pin creation.

	|| HttpMethod | {status:colour=Yellow|title=post|subtle=false} |
    || Protocol | {noformat:nopanel=true}https{noformat} |
    || Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}/pins{noformat} |
    || Base Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}https://api.pinterest.com/v5{noformat} |
    || Produces | {noformat:nopanel=true}application/json {noformat} |
----
h4. Parameters

h5. Body Parameter
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |PinCreate |Create a new Pin. | PinCreate | (/) | |  |  |


h5. Query Parameters
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |ad_account_id |Unique identifier of an ad account. | String | (x) |null | /^\\d+$/ |  |
----
h4. Responses

    	|| Status Code | {status:colour=Green|title=201|subtle=false} |
    	|| Message | Successful pin creation. |
    	|| Response Type | Pin |

  }

  "description" : "Invalid Pin parameters response",

      },

          "value" : {
            "code" : 1,

          }
        }
      }
    }

{panel}



h3. pins/delete
{panel:title=pins/delete|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#003b6f|titleBGColor=#003b6f|titleColor=#a6b8c7|bgColor=#ffffff}
    *Summary:* Delete Pin
    *Description:* Delete a Pins owned by the &quot;operation user_account&quot; - or on a group board that has been shared with this account.
- By default, the &quot;operation user_account&quot; is the token user_account.

Optional: Business Access: Specify an &lt;code&gt;ad_account_id&lt;/code&gt; (obtained via &lt;a href&#x3D;&#39;/docs/api/v5/#operation/ad_accounts/list&#39;&gt;List ad accounts&lt;/a&gt;) to use the owner of that ad_account as the &quot;operation user_account&quot;. In order to do this, the token user_account must have one of the following &lt;a href&#x3D;&quot;https://help.pinterest.com/en/business/article/share-and-manage-access-to-your-ad-accounts&quot;&gt;Business Access&lt;/a&gt; roles on the ad_account:

- For Pins on public or protected boards: Owner, Admin, Analyst, Campaign Manager.
- For Pins on secret boards: Owner, Admin.

	|| HttpMethod | {status:colour=Yellow|title=delete|subtle=false} |
    || Protocol | {noformat:nopanel=true}https{noformat} |
    || Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}/pins/{pin_id}{noformat} |
    || Base Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}https://api.pinterest.com/v5{noformat} |
    || Produces | {noformat:nopanel=true}application/json {noformat} |
----
h4. Parameters
h5. Path Parameters
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |pin_id |Unique identifier of a Pin. | String | (/) |null |  |  |



h5. Query Parameters
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |ad_account_id |Unique identifier of an ad account. | String | (x) |null | /^\\d+$/ |  |
----
h4. Responses

    	|| Status Code | {status:colour=Green|title=204|subtle=false} |
    	|| Message | Successfully deleted Pin |
    	|| Response Type |  |
    	|| Response Model | [ Model|#ModelAnchor|Jump to model] |
    	|| Response Schema | {code:collapse=true}{
  "description" : "Successfully deleted Pin"
}{code} |
       


    	|| Status Code | {status:colour=Orange|title=403|subtle=false} |
    	|| Message | Not authorized to access board or Pin. |
    	|| Response Type | Error |
    	|| Response Model | [Error Model|#ErrorModelAnchor|Jump to model] |
    	|| Response Schema | {code:collapse=true}{
  "description" : "Not authorized to access board or Pin.",
  "content" : {
    "application/json" : {
      "schema" : {
        "$ref" : "#/components/schemas/Error"
      },
      "example" : {
        "code" : 403,
        "message" : "Not authorized to access board or Pin."
      }
    }
  }
}{code} |
       


    	|| Status Code | {status:colour=Orange|title=404|subtle=false} |
    	|| Message | Pin not found. |
    	|| Response Type | Error |
    	|| Response Model | [Error Model|#ErrorModelAnchor|Jump to model] |
    	|| Response Schema | {code:collapse=true}{
  "description" : "Pin not found.",
  "content" : {

      "schema" : {
        "$ref" : "#/components/schemas/Error"
      },
      "example" : {
        "code" : 404,
        "message" : "Pin not found."
      }
    }
  }
}{code} |
       


    	|| Status Code | {status:colour=Red|title=0|subtle=false} |
    	|| Message | Unexpected error |
    	|| Response Type | Error |

  "description" : "Unexpected error",
  "content" : {
    "application/json" : {
      "schema" : {

h3. pins/get
{panel:title=pins/get|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#003b6f|titleBGColor=#003b6f|titleColor=#a6b8c7|bgColor=#ffffff}
    *Summary:* Get Pin
    *Description:* Get a Pin owned by the &quot;operation user_account&quot; - or on a group board that has been shared with this account.
- By default, the &quot;operation user_account&quot; is the token user_account.

Optional: Business Access: Specify an &lt;code&gt;ad_account_id&lt;/code&gt; (obtained via &lt;a href&#x3D;&#39;/docs/api/v5/#operation/ad_accounts/list&#39;&gt;List ad accounts&lt;/a&gt;) to use the owner of that ad_account as the &quot;operation user_account&quot;. In order to do this, the token user_account must have one of the following &lt;a href&#x3D;&quot;https://help.pinterest.com/en/business/article/share-and-manage-access-to-your-ad-accounts&quot;&gt;Business Access&lt;/a&gt; roles on the ad_account:

- For Pins on public or protected boards: Owner, Admin, Analyst, Campaign Manager.
- For Pins on secret boards: Owner, Admin.

	|| HttpMethod | {status:colour=Yellow|title=get|subtle=false} |
    || Protocol | {noformat:nopanel=true}https{noformat} |
    || Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}/pins/{pin_id}{noformat} |
    || Base Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}https://api.pinterest.com/v5{noformat} |
    || Produces | {noformat:nopanel=true}application/json {noformat} |

        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |pin_id |Unique identifier of a Pin. | String | (/) |null |  |  |

        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |pin_metrics |Specify whether to return 90d and lifetime Pin metrics. Total comments and total reactions are only available with lifetime Pin metrics. If Pin was created before &lt;code&gt;2023-03-20&lt;/code&gt; lifetime metrics will only be available for Video and Idea Pin formats. Lifetime metrics are available for all Pin formats since then. | Boolean | (x) |false |  |  ||ad_account_id |Unique identifier of an ad account. | String | (x) |null | /^\\d+$/ |  |

h3. pins/list
{panel:title=pins/list|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#003b6f|titleBGColor=#003b6f|titleColor=#a6b8c7|bgColor=#ffffff}
    *Summary:* List Pins
    *Description:* Get a list of the Pins owned by the &quot;operation user_account&quot;.
- By default, the &quot;operation user_account&quot; is the token user_account.
- All Pins owned by the &quot;operation user_account&quot; are included, regardless of who owns the board they are on.
Optional: Business Access: Specify an ad_account_id to use the owner of that ad_account as the &quot;operation user_account&quot;.

	|| HttpMethod | {status:colour=Yellow|title=get|subtle=false} |
    || Protocol | {noformat:nopanel=true}https{noformat} |
    || Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}/pins{noformat} |
    || Base Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}https://api.pinterest.com/v5{noformat} |
    || Produces | {noformat:nopanel=true}application/json {noformat} |
----
h4. Parameters



h5. Query Parameters
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |bookmark |Cursor used to fetch the next page of items | String | (x) |null |  |  ||page_size |Maximum number of items to include in a single page of the response. See documentation on &lt;a href&#x3D;&#39;/docs/getting-started/pagination/&#39;&gt;Pagination&lt;/a&gt; for more information. | Integer | (x) |25 |  |  ||pin_filter |Pin filter. | String | (x) |null |  | [exclude_native, exclude_repins, has_been_promoted] ||include_protected_pins |Specify if return pins from protected boards | Boolean | (x) |false |  |  ||pin_type |The type of pins to return, currently only enabled for private pins | String | (x) |null |  | [PRIVATE] ||creative_types |Pin creative types filter. &lt;/p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Note:&lt;/strong&gt; SHOP_THE_PIN has been deprecated. Please use COLLECTION instead. | array[String] | (x) |null |  |  ||ad_account_id |Unique identifier of an ad account. | String | (x) |null | /^\\d+$/ |  ||pin_metrics |Specify whether to return 90d and lifetime Pin metrics. Total comments and total reactions are only available with lifetime Pin metrics. If Pin was created before &lt;code&gt;2023-03-20&lt;/code&gt; lifetime metrics will only be available for Video and Idea Pin formats. Lifetime metrics are available for all Pin formats since then. | Boolean | (x) |false |  |  |

      }
    }
  }
}{code} |

      }
    }

h3. pins/save
{panel:title=pins/save|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#003b6f|titleBGColor=#003b6f|titleColor=#a6b8c7|bgColor=#ffffff}
    *Summary:* Save Pin
    *Description:* Save a Pin on a board or board section owned by the &quot;operation user_account&quot;.
- By default, the &quot;operation user_account&quot; is the token user_account.
Optional: Business Access: Specify an &lt;code&gt;ad_account_id&lt;/code&gt; (obtained via &lt;a href&#x3D;&#39;/docs/api/v5/#operation/ad_accounts/list&#39;&gt;List ad accounts&lt;/a&gt;) to use the owner of that ad_account as the &quot;operation user_account&quot;. In order to do this, the token user_account must have one of the following &lt;a href&#x3D;&quot;https://help.pinterest.com/en/business/article/share-and-manage-access-to-your-ad-accounts&quot;&gt;Business Access&lt;/a&gt; roles on the ad_account:

- For Pins on public or protected boards: Owner, Admin, Analyst, Campaign Manager.
- For Pins on secret boards: Owner, Admin.

- Any Pin type can be saved: image Pin, video Pin, Idea Pin, product Pin, etc.
- Any public Pin can be saved given a pin ID.

	|| HttpMethod | {status:colour=Yellow|title=post|subtle=false} |
    || Protocol | {noformat:nopanel=true}https{noformat} |
    || Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}/pins/{pin_id}/save{noformat} |
    || Base Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}https://api.pinterest.com/v5{noformat} |
    || Produces | {noformat:nopanel=true}application/json {noformat} |
----
h4. Parameters
h5. Path Parameters
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |pin_id |Unique identifier of a Pin. | String | (/) |null |  |  |

h5. Body Parameter
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |PinsSaveRequest |Request object used to save an existing pin | PinsSaveRequest | (/) | |  |  |


h5. Query Parameters
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |ad_account_id |Unique identifier of an ad account. | String | (x) |null | /^\\d+$/ |  |
----
h4. Responses

    	|| Status Code | {status:colour=Green|title=201|subtle=false} |
    	|| Message | Successfully saved pin. |
    	|| Response Type | Pin |
    	|| Response Model | [Pin Model|#PinModelAnchor|Jump to model] |
    	|| Response Schema | {code:collapse=true}{
  "description" : "Successfully saved pin.",
  "content" : {
    "application/json" : {
      "schema" : {
        "$ref" : "#/components/schemas/Pin"
      }
    }
  }
}{code} |
       


    	|| Status Code | {status:colour=Orange|title=403|subtle=false} |
    	|| Message | Not authorized to access Board or Pin. |
    	|| Response Type | Error |
    	|| Response Model | [Error Model|#ErrorModelAnchor|Jump to model] |
    	|| Response Schema | {code:collapse=true}{
  "description" : "Not authorized to access Board or Pin.",
  "content" : {
    "application/json" : {
      "schema" : {
        "$ref" : "#/components/schemas/Error"
      },
      "example" : {
        "code" : 29,
        "message" : "You are not permitted to access that resource."
      }
    }
  }
}{code} |
       


    	|| Status Code | {status:colour=Orange|title=404|subtle=false} |
    	|| Message | Board or Pin not found. |
    	|| Response Type | Error |
    	|| Response Model | [Error Model|#ErrorModelAnchor|Jump to model] |
    	|| Response Schema | {code:collapse=true}{
  "description" : "Board or Pin not found.",
  "content" : {
    "application/json" : {
      "schema" : {
        "$ref" : "#/components/schemas/Error"
      },
      "examples" : {
        "BoardNotFound" : {
          "value" : {
            "code" : 40,
            "message" : "Board not found."
          }
        },
        "PinNotFound" : {
          "value" : {
            "code" : 50,
            "message" : "Pin not found."
          }
        },
        "BoardSectionNotFound" : {
          "value" : {
            "code" : 2031,
            "message" : "Sorry! We couldn't find this board section."
          }
        }
      }
    }
  }
}{code} |
       


    	|| Status Code | {status:colour=Red|title=0|subtle=false} |
    	|| Message | Unexpected error |
    	|| Response Type | Error |
    	|| Response Model | [Error Model|#ErrorModelAnchor|Jump to model] |
    	|| Response Schema | {code:collapse=true}{
  "description" : "Unexpected error",
  "content" : {
    "application/json" : {
      "schema" : {
        "$ref" : "#/components/schemas/Error"
      }
    }
  }
}{code} |

h3. pins/update
{panel:title=pins/update|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#003b6f|titleBGColor=#003b6f|titleColor=#a6b8c7|bgColor=#ffffff}
    *Summary:* Update Pin
    *Description:* Update a pin owned by the &quot;operating user_account&quot;.
- By default, the &quot;operation user_account&quot; is the token user_account.

Optional: Business Access: Specify an &lt;code&gt;ad_account_id&lt;/code&gt; (obtained via &lt;a href&#x3D;&#39;/docs/api/v5/#operation/ad_accounts/list&#39;&gt;List ad accounts&lt;/a&gt;) to use the owner of that ad_account as the &quot;operation user_account&quot;. In order to do this, the token user_account must have one of the following &lt;a href&#x3D;&quot;https://help.pinterest.com/en/business/article/share-and-manage-access-to-your-ad-accounts&quot;&gt;Business Access&lt;/a&gt; roles on the ad_account:

- For Pins on public or protected boards: Owner, Admin, Analyst, Campaign Manager.
- For Pins on secret boards: Owner, Admin.

&lt;strong&gt;This endpoint is currently in beta and not available to all apps. &lt;a href&#x3D;&#39;/docs/new/about-beta-access/&#39;&gt;Learn more&lt;/a&gt;.&lt;/strong&gt;

	|| HttpMethod | {status:colour=Yellow|title=patch|subtle=false} |
    || Protocol | {noformat:nopanel=true}https{noformat} |
    || Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}/pins/{pin_id}{noformat} |
    || Base Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}https://api.pinterest.com/v5{noformat} |
    || Produces | {noformat:nopanel=true}application/json {noformat} |
----
h4. Parameters
h5. Path Parameters
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |pin_id |Unique identifier of a Pin. | String | (/) |null |  |  |

h5. Body Parameter
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||

    *Description:* Add one or more product groups from your catalog to an existing ad group. (Product groups added to an ad group are a &#39;product group promotion.&#39;)

h3. productGroupPromotions/list
{panel:title=productGroupPromotions/list|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#003b6f|titleBGColor=#003b6f|titleColor=#a6b8c7|bgColor=#ffffff}
    *Summary:* Get product group promotions
    *Description:* List existing product group promotions associated with an ad account.

Include either ad_group_id or product_group_promotion_ids in your request.

&lt;b&gt;Note:&lt;/b&gt; ad_group_ids and product_group_promotion_ids are mutually exclusive parameters.
Only provide one. If multiple options are provided, product_group_promotion_ids takes precedence over ad_group_ids. If none are provided, the endpoint returns an error.

	|| HttpMethod | {status:colour=Yellow|title=get|subtle=false} |
    || Protocol | {noformat:nopanel=true}https{noformat} |
    || Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}/ad_accounts/{ad_account_id}/product_group_promotions{noformat} |
    || Base Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}https://api.pinterest.com/v5{noformat} |
    || Produces | {noformat:nopanel=true}application/json {noformat} |
----
h4. Parameters
h5. Path Parameters
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |ad_account_id |Unique identifier of an ad account. | String | (/) |null | /^\\d+$/ |  |



h5. Query Parameters
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |product_group_promotion_ids |List of Product group promotion Ids. | array[String] | (x) |null |  |  ||entity_statuses |Entity status | array[String] | (x) |[&quot;ACTIVE&quot;,&quot;PAUSED&quot;] |  |  ||ad_group_id |Ad group Id. | String | (x) |null | /^\\d+$/ |  ||page_size |Maximum number of items to include in a single page of the response. See documentation on &lt;a href&#x3D;&#39;/docs/getting-started/pagination/&#39;&gt;Pagination&lt;/a&gt; for more information. | Integer | (x) |25 |  |  ||order |The order in which to sort the items returned: “ASCENDING” or “DESCENDING”
by ID. Note that higher-value IDs are associated with more-recently added
items. | String | (x) |null |  | [ASCENDING, DESCENDING] ||bookmark |Cursor used to fetch the next page of items | String | (x) |null |  |  |
----
h4. Responses

    	|| Status Code | {status:colour=Green|title=200|subtle=false} |
    	|| Message | Success |
    	|| Response Type | product_group_promotions_list_200_response |
    	|| Response Model | [product_group_promotions_list_200_response Model|#product_group_promotions_list_200_responseModelAnchor|Jump to model] |
    	|| Response Schema | {code:collapse=true}{
  "description" : "Success",
  "content" : {
    "application/json" : {
      "schema" : {
        "$ref" : "#/components/schemas/product_group_promotions_list_200_response"
      }
    }
  }
}{code} |
       


    	|| Status Code | {status:colour=Red|title=0|subtle=false} |

h3. productGroups/analytics
{panel:title=productGroups/analytics|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#003b6f|titleBGColor=#003b6f|titleColor=#a6b8c7|bgColor=#ffffff}
    *Summary:* Get product group analytics
    *Description:* Get analytics for the specified product groups in the specified &lt;code&gt;ad_account_id&lt;/code&gt;, filtered by the specified options.
- The token&#39;s user_account must either be the Owner of the specified ad account, or have one of the necessary roles granted to them via &lt;a href&#x3D;&quot;https://help.pinterest.com/en/business/article/share-and-manage-access-to-your-ad-accounts&quot;&gt;Business Access&lt;/a&gt;: Admin, Analyst, Campaign Manager.
- If granularity is not HOUR, the furthest back you can are allowed to pull data is 90 days before the current date in UTC time and the max time range supported is 90 days.
- If granularity is HOUR, the furthest back you can are allowed to pull data is 8 days before the current date in UTC time and the max time range supported is 3 days.

	|| HttpMethod | {status:colour=Yellow|title=get|subtle=false} |
    || Protocol | {noformat:nopanel=true}https{noformat} |
    || Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}/ad_accounts/{ad_account_id}/product_groups/analytics{noformat} |
    || Base Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}https://api.pinterest.com/v5{noformat} |
    || Produces | {noformat:nopanel=true}application/json {noformat} |
----
h4. Parameters
h5. Path Parameters
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |ad_account_id |Unique identifier of an ad account. | String | (/) |null | /^\\d+$/ |  |



h5. Query Parameters
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |start_date |Metric report start date (UTC). Format: YYYY-MM-DD. Cannot be more than 90 days back from today. | date | (/) |null |  |  ||end_date |Metric report end date (UTC). Format: YYYY-MM-DD. Cannot be more than 90 days past start_date. | date | (/) |null |  |  ||product_group_ids |List of Product group Ids to use to filter the results. | array[String] | (/) |null |  |  ||columns |Columns to retrieve, encoded as a comma-separated string. **NOTE**: Any metrics defined as MICRO_DOLLARS returns a value based on the advertiser profile&#39;s currency field. For USD,($1/1,000,000, or $0.000001 - one one-ten-thousandth of a cent). it&#39;s microdollars. Otherwise, it&#39;s in microunits of the advertiser&#39;s currency.&lt;br/&gt;For example, if the advertiser&#39;s currency is GBP (British pound sterling), all MICRO_DOLLARS fields will be in GBP microunits (1/1,000,000 British pound).&lt;br/&gt;If a column has no value, it may not be returned | array[String] | (/) |null |  |  ||granularity |TOTAL - metrics are aggregated over the specified date range.&lt;br&gt; DAY - metrics are broken down daily.&lt;br&gt; HOUR - metrics are broken down hourly.&lt;br&gt;WEEKLY - metrics are broken down weekly.&lt;br&gt;MONTHLY - metrics are broken down monthly | Granularity | (/) |null |  |  ||click_window_days |Number of days to use as the conversion attribution window for a pin click action. Applies to Pinterest Tag conversion metrics. Prior conversion tags use their defined attribution windows. If not specified, defaults to &#x60;30&#x60; days. | Integer | (x) |30 |  | [0, 1, 7, 14, 30, 60] ||engagement_window_days |Number of days to use as the conversion attribution window for an engagement action. Engagements include saves, closeups, link clicks, and carousel card swipes. Applies to Pinterest Tag conversion metrics. Prior conversion tags use their defined attribution windows. If not specified, defaults to &#x60;30&#x60; days. | Integer | (x) |30 |  | [0, 1, 7, 14, 30, 60] ||view_window_days |Number of days to use as the conversion attribution window for a view action. Applies to Pinterest Tag conversion metrics. Prior conversion tags use their defined attribution windows. If not specified, defaults to &#x60;1&#x60; day. | Integer | (x) |1 |  | [0, 1, 7, 14, 30, 60] ||conversion_report_time |The date by which the conversion metrics returned from this endpoint will be reported. There are two dates associated with a conversion event: the date that the user interacted with the ad, and the date that the user completed a conversion event. | String | (x) |TIME_OF_AD_ACTION |  | [TIME_OF_AD_ACTION, TIME_OF_CONVERSION] |
----
h4. Responses

    	|| Status Code | {status:colour=Green|title=200|subtle=false} |
    	|| Message | Success |
    	|| Response Type | array[ProductGroupAnalyticsResponse_inner] |
    	|| Response Model | [array[ProductGroupAnalyticsResponse_inner] Model|#array[ProductGroupAnalyticsResponse_inner]ModelAnchor|Jump to model] |
    	|| Response Schema | {code:collapse=true}{
  "description" : "Success",
  "content" : {
    "application/json" : {
      "schema" : {
        "$ref" : "#/components/schemas/ProductGroupAnalyticsResponse"
      }
    }
  }
}{code} |
       


    	|| Status Code | {status:colour=Orange|title=400|subtle=false} |
    	|| Message | Invalid ad account ads analytics parameters. |
    	|| Response Type | Error |
    	|| Response Model | [Error Model|#ErrorModelAnchor|Jump to model] |
    	|| Response Schema | {code:collapse=true}{
  "description" : "Invalid ad account ads analytics parameters.",

      },

      }
    }
  }

h3. deliveryMetrics/get
{panel:title=deliveryMetrics/get|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#003b6f|titleBGColor=#003b6f|titleColor=#a6b8c7|bgColor=#ffffff}
    *Summary:* Get available metrics&#39; definitions
    *Description:* Get the definitions for ads and organic metrics available across both synchronous and asynchronous report endpoints.
The &#x60;display_name&#x60; attribute will match how the metric is named in our native tools like Ads Manager.
See &lt;a href&#x3D;&#39;/docs/content/analytics/&#39;&gt;Organic Analytics&lt;/a&gt; and &lt;a href&#x3D;&#39;/docs/ads/ad-analytics-reporting/&#39;&gt;Ads Analytics&lt;/a&gt; for more information.

	|| HttpMethod | {status:colour=Yellow|title=get|subtle=false} |
    || Protocol | {noformat:nopanel=true}https{noformat} |
    || Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}/resources/delivery_metrics{noformat} |
    || Base Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}https://api.pinterest.com/v5{noformat} |
    || Produces | {noformat:nopanel=true}application/json {noformat} |

h3. targetingOptions/get

    *Summary:* Get targeting options
    *Description:* &lt;p&gt;You can use targeting values in ads placement to define your intended audience. &lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;Targeting metrics are organized around targeting specifications.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;For more information on ads targeting, see &lt;a class&#x3D;&quot;reference external&quot; href&#x3D;&quot;https://help.pinterest.com/en/business/article/audience-targeting&quot; target&#x3D;&quot;_blank&quot;&gt;Audience targeting&lt;/a&gt;.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p&gt;&lt;b&gt;Sample return:&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;pre class&#x3D;&quot;literal-block&quot;&gt; [\{&amp;quot;36313&amp;quot;: &amp;quot;Australia: Moreton Bay - North&amp;quot;, &amp;quot;124735&amp;quot;: &amp;quot;Canada: North Battleford&amp;quot;, &amp;quot;36109&amp;quot;: &amp;quot;Australia: Murray&amp;quot;, &amp;quot;36108&amp;quot;: &amp;quot;Australia: Mid North Coast&amp;quot;, &amp;quot;36101&amp;quot;: &amp;quot;Australia: Capital Region&amp;quot;, &amp;quot;811&amp;quot;: &amp;quot;U.S.: Reno&amp;quot;, &amp;quot;36103&amp;quot;: &amp;quot;Australia: Central West&amp;quot;, &amp;quot;36102&amp;quot;: &amp;quot;Australia: Central Coast&amp;quot;, &amp;quot;36105&amp;quot;: &amp;quot;Australia: Far West and Orana&amp;quot;, &amp;quot;36104&amp;quot;: &amp;quot;Australia: Coffs Harbour - Grafton&amp;quot;, &amp;quot;36107&amp;quot;: &amp;quot;Australia: Illawarra&amp;quot;, &amp;quot;36106&amp;quot;: &amp;quot;Australia: Hunter Valley Exc Newcastle&amp;quot;, &amp;quot;554017&amp;quot;: &amp;quot;New Zealand: Wanganui&amp;quot;, &amp;quot;554016&amp;quot;: &amp;quot;New Zealand: Marlborough&amp;quot;, &amp;quot;554015&amp;quot;: &amp;quot;New Zealand: Gisborne&amp;quot;, &amp;quot;554014&amp;quot;: &amp;quot;New Zealand: Tararua&amp;quot;, &amp;quot;554013&amp;quot;: &amp;quot;New Zealand: Invercargill&amp;quot;, &amp;quot;GR&amp;quot;: &amp;quot;Greece&amp;quot;, &amp;quot;554011&amp;quot;: &amp;quot;New Zealand: Whangarei&amp;quot;, &amp;quot;554010&amp;quot;: &amp;quot;New Zealand: Far North&amp;quot;, &amp;quot;717&amp;quot;: &amp;quot;U.S.: Quincy-Hannibal-Keokuk&amp;quot;, &amp;quot;716&amp;quot;: &amp;quot;U.S.: Baton Rouge&amp;quot;,...\}\] &lt;/pre&gt;

    *Description:* &lt;strong&gt;This endpoint is currently in beta and not available to all apps. &lt;a href&#x3D;&#39;/docs/new/about-beta-access/&#39;&gt;Learn more&lt;/a&gt;.&lt;/strong&gt;

	|| HttpMethod | {status:colour=Yellow|title=get|subtle=false} |

    || Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}/search/partner/pins{noformat} |

        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |term |Search term to look up pins. | String | (/) |null |  |  ||country_code |Two letter country code (ISO 3166-1 alpha-2) | String | (/) |null |  |  ||bookmark |Cursor used to fetch the next page of items | String | (x) |null |  |  ||locale |Search locale. | String | (x) |null |  |  ||limit |Max search result size | Integer | (x) |10 |  |  |

h3. searchUserBoards/get
{panel:title=searchUserBoards/get|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#003b6f|titleBGColor=#003b6f|titleColor=#a6b8c7|bgColor=#ffffff}
    *Summary:* Search user&#39;s boards
    *Description:* Search for boards for the &quot;operation user_account&quot;. This includes boards of all board types.
- By default, the &quot;operation user_account&quot; is the token user_account.

If using Business Access: Specify an ad_account_id to use the owner of that ad_account as the &quot;operation user_account&quot;. See &lt;a href&#x3D;&#39;/docs/reference/business-access/&#39;&gt;Understanding Business Access&lt;/a&gt; for more information.

	|| HttpMethod | {status:colour=Yellow|title=get|subtle=false} |
    || Protocol | {noformat:nopanel=true}https{noformat} |
    || Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}/search/boards{noformat} |
    || Base Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}https://api.pinterest.com/v5{noformat} |
    || Produces | {noformat:nopanel=true}application/json {noformat} |
----
h4. Parameters



h5. Query Parameters
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |ad_account_id |Unique identifier of an ad account. | String | (x) |null | /^\\d+$/ |  ||bookmark |Cursor used to fetch the next page of items | String | (x) |null |  |  ||page_size |Maximum number of items to include in a single page of the response. See documentation on &lt;a href&#x3D;&#39;/docs/getting-started/pagination/&#39;&gt;Pagination&lt;/a&gt; for more information. | Integer | (x) |25 |  |  ||query |Search query. Can contain pin description keywords or comma-separated pin IDs. | String | (x) |null |  |  |
----
h4. Responses

    	|| Status Code | {status:colour=Green|title=200|subtle=false} |
    	|| Message | response |
    	|| Response Type | search_user_boards_get_200_response |
    	|| Response Model | [search_user_boards_get_200_response Model|#search_user_boards_get_200_responseModelAnchor|Jump to model] |
    	|| Response Schema | {code:collapse=true}{
  "description" : "response",
  "content" : {
    "application/json" : {
      "schema" : {
        "$ref" : "#/components/schemas/search_user_boards_get_200_response"
      }
    }
  }
}{code} |
       


    	|| Status Code | {status:colour=Red|title=0|subtle=false} |
    	|| Message | Unexpected error |
    	|| Response Type | Error |
    	|| Response Model | [Error Model|#ErrorModelAnchor|Jump to model] |
    	|| Response Schema | {code:collapse=true}{
  "description" : "Unexpected error",

    *Description:* Get a list of terms logically related to each input term. &lt;p/&gt;
Example: the term &#39;workout&#39; would list related terms like &#39;one song workout&#39;, &#39;yoga workout&#39;, &#39;workout motivation&#39;, etc.

h3. termsSuggested/list
{panel:title=termsSuggested/list|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#003b6f|titleBGColor=#003b6f|titleColor=#a6b8c7|bgColor=#ffffff}
    *Summary:* List suggested terms
    *Description:* Get popular search terms that begin with your input term. &lt;p/&gt;
Example: &#39;sport&#39; would return popular terms like &#39;sports bar&#39; and &#39;sportswear&#39;, but not &#39;motor sports&#39; since the phrase does not begin with the given term.

	|| HttpMethod | {status:colour=Yellow|title=get|subtle=false} |
    || Protocol | {noformat:nopanel=true}https{noformat} |
    || Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}/terms/suggested{noformat} |
    || Base Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}https://api.pinterest.com/v5{noformat} |
    || Produces | {noformat:nopanel=true}application/json {noformat} |
----
h4. Parameters



h5. Query Parameters
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |term |Input term. | String | (/) |null |  |  ||limit |Max suggested terms to return. | Integer | (x) |4 |  |  |

  }

h3. userAccount/analytics
{panel:title=userAccount/analytics|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#003b6f|titleBGColor=#003b6f|titleColor=#a6b8c7|bgColor=#ffffff}
    *Summary:* Get user account analytics
    *Description:* Get analytics for the &quot;operation user_account&quot;
- By default, the &quot;operation user_account&quot; is the token user_account.

Optional: Business Access: Specify an ad_account_id to use the owner of that ad_account as the &quot;operation user_account&quot;.

	|| HttpMethod | {status:colour=Yellow|title=get|subtle=false} |
    || Protocol | {noformat:nopanel=true}https{noformat} |
    || Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}/user_account/analytics{noformat} |
    || Base Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}https://api.pinterest.com/v5{noformat} |
    || Produces | {noformat:nopanel=true}application/json {noformat} |
----
h4. Parameters



h5. Query Parameters
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |start_date |Metric report start date (UTC). Format: YYYY-MM-DD. Cannot be more than 90 days back from today. | date | (/) |null |  |  ||end_date |Metric report end date (UTC). Format: YYYY-MM-DD. Cannot be more than 90 days past start_date. | date | (/) |null |  |  ||from_claimed_content |Filter on Pins that match your claimed domain. | String | (x) |BOTH |  | [OTHER, CLAIMED, BOTH] ||pin_format |Pin formats to get data for, default is all. | String | (x) |ALL |  | [ALL, ORGANIC_IMAGE, ORGANIC_PRODUCT, ORGANIC_VIDEO, ADS_STANDARD, ADS_PRODUCT, ADS_VIDEO, ADS_IDEA, PRODUCT, REGULAR, VIDEO] ||app_types |Apps or devices to get data for, default is all. | String | (x) |ALL |  | [ALL, MOBILE, TABLET, WEB] ||content_type |Filter to paid or organic data. Default is all. | String | (x) |ALL |  | [ALL, PAID, ORGANIC] ||source |Filter to activity from Pins created and saved by your, or activity created and saved by others from your claimed accounts | String | (x) |ALL |  | [ALL, YOUR_PINS, OTHER_PINS] ||metric_types |Metric types to get data for, default is all.  | array[String] | (x) |null |  |  ||split_field |How to split the data into groups. Not including this param means data won&#39;t be split. | String | (x) |NO_SPLIT |  | [NO_SPLIT, APP_TYPE, OWNED_CONTENT, SOURCE, PIN_FORMAT] ||ad_account_id |Unique identifier of an ad account. | String | (x) |null | /^\\d+$/ |  |
----
h4. Responses

    	|| Status Code | {status:colour=Green|title=200|subtle=false} |
    	|| Message | Success |
    	|| Response Type | map[String, AnalyticsMetricsResponse] |
    	|| Response Model | [map[String, AnalyticsMetricsResponse] Model|#map[String, AnalyticsMetricsResponse]ModelAnchor|Jump to model] |
    	|| Response Schema | {code:collapse=true}{
  "description" : "Success",
  "content" : {
    "application/json" : {
      "schema" : {
        "$ref" : "#/components/schemas/AnalyticsResponse"
      }
    }
  }
}{code} |
       


    	|| Status Code | {status:colour=Orange|title=400|subtle=false} |
    	|| Message | Invalid user accounts analytics parameters. |
    	|| Response Type | Error |
    	|| Response Model | [Error Model|#ErrorModelAnchor|Jump to model] |
    	|| Response Schema | {code:collapse=true}{
  "description" : "Invalid user accounts analytics parameters.",
  "content" : {
    "application/json" : {
      "schema" : {
        "$ref" : "#/components/schemas/Error"
      },
      "example" : {
        "code" : 400,
        "message" : "Invalid user accounts analytics parameters."
      }
    }
  }
}{code} |
       


    	|| Status Code | {status:colour=Orange|title=403|subtle=false} |
    	|| Message | Not authorized to access the user account analytics. |

    }
  }

h3. userAccount/analytics/topPins
{panel:title=userAccount/analytics/topPins|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#003b6f|titleBGColor=#003b6f|titleColor=#a6b8c7|bgColor=#ffffff}
    *Summary:* Get user account top pins analytics
    *Description:* Gets analytics data about a user&#39;s top pins (limited to the top 50).
- By default, the &quot;operation user_account&quot; is the token user_account.

Optional: Business Access: Specify an ad_account_id to use the owner of that ad_account as the &quot;operation user_account&quot;.

	|| HttpMethod | {status:colour=Yellow|title=get|subtle=false} |
    || Protocol | {noformat:nopanel=true}https{noformat} |
    || Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}/user_account/analytics/top_pins{noformat} |
    || Base Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}https://api.pinterest.com/v5{noformat} |
    || Produces | {noformat:nopanel=true}application/json {noformat} |
----
h4. Parameters



h5. Query Parameters
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |start_date |Metric report start date (UTC). Format: YYYY-MM-DD. Cannot be more than 90 days back from today. | date | (/) |null |  |  ||end_date |Metric report end date (UTC). Format: YYYY-MM-DD. Cannot be more than 90 days past start_date. | date | (/) |null |  |  ||sort_by |Specify sorting order for metrics | String | (/) |null |  | [ENGAGEMENT, IMPRESSION, OUTBOUND_CLICK, PIN_CLICK, SAVE] ||from_claimed_content |Filter on Pins that match your claimed domain. | String | (x) |BOTH |  | [OTHER, CLAIMED, BOTH] ||pin_format |Pin formats to get data for, default is all. | String | (x) |ALL |  | [ALL, ORGANIC_IMAGE, ORGANIC_PRODUCT, ORGANIC_VIDEO, ADS_STANDARD, ADS_PRODUCT, ADS_VIDEO, ADS_IDEA, PRODUCT, REGULAR, VIDEO] ||app_types |Apps or devices to get data for, default is all. | String | (x) |ALL |  | [ALL, MOBILE, TABLET, WEB] ||content_type |Filter to paid or organic data. Default is all. | String | (x) |ALL |  | [ALL, PAID, ORGANIC] ||source |Filter to activity from Pins created and saved by your, or activity created and saved by others from your claimed accounts | String | (x) |ALL |  | [ALL, YOUR_PINS, OTHER_PINS] ||metric_types |Metric types to get data for, default is all.  | array[String] | (x) |null |  |  ||num_of_pins |Number of pins to include, default is 10. Max is 50. | Integer | (x) |10 |  |  ||created_in_last_n_days |Get metrics for pins created in the last &quot;n&quot; days. | Integer | (x) |null |  | [30] ||ad_account_id |Unique identifier of an ad account. | String | (x) |null | /^\\d+$/ |  |

h3. userAccount/analytics/topVideoPins
{panel:title=userAccount/analytics/topVideoPins|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#003b6f|titleBGColor=#003b6f|titleColor=#a6b8c7|bgColor=#ffffff}
    *Summary:* Get user account top video pins analytics
    *Description:* Gets analytics data about a user&#39;s top video pins (limited to the top 50).
- By default, the &quot;operation user_account&quot; is the token user_account.

Optional: Business Access: Specify an ad_account_id to use the owner of that ad_account as the &quot;operation user_account&quot;.

	|| HttpMethod | {status:colour=Yellow|title=get|subtle=false} |
    || Protocol | {noformat:nopanel=true}https{noformat} |
    || Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}/user_account/analytics/top_video_pins{noformat} |
    || Base Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}https://api.pinterest.com/v5{noformat} |
    || Produces | {noformat:nopanel=true}application/json {noformat} |
----

h5. Query Parameters
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |start_date |Metric report start date (UTC). Format: YYYY-MM-DD. Cannot be more than 90 days back from today. | date | (/) |null |  |  ||end_date |Metric report end date (UTC). Format: YYYY-MM-DD. Cannot be more than 90 days past start_date. | date | (/) |null |  |  ||sort_by |Specify sorting order for video metrics | String | (/) |null |  | [IMPRESSION, SAVE, OUTBOUND_CLICK, VIDEO_MRC_VIEW, VIDEO_AVG_WATCH_TIME, VIDEO_V50_WATCH_TIME, QUARTILE_95_PERCENT_VIEW, VIDEO_10S_VIEW, VIDEO_START] ||from_claimed_content |Filter on Pins that match your claimed domain. | String | (x) |BOTH |  | [OTHER, CLAIMED, BOTH] ||pin_format |Pin formats to get data for, default is all. | String | (x) |ALL |  | [ALL, ORGANIC_IMAGE, ORGANIC_PRODUCT, ORGANIC_VIDEO, ADS_STANDARD, ADS_PRODUCT, ADS_VIDEO, ADS_IDEA, PRODUCT, REGULAR, VIDEO] ||app_types |Apps or devices to get data for, default is all. | String | (x) |ALL |  | [ALL, MOBILE, TABLET, WEB] ||content_type |Filter to paid or organic data. Default is all. | String | (x) |ALL |  | [ALL, PAID, ORGANIC] ||source |Filter to activity from Pins created and saved by your, or activity created and saved by others from your claimed accounts | String | (x) |ALL |  | [ALL, YOUR_PINS, OTHER_PINS] ||metric_types |Metric types to get video data for, default is all.  | array[String] | (x) |null |  |  ||num_of_pins |Number of pins to include, default is 10. Max is 50. | Integer | (x) |10 |  |  ||created_in_last_n_days |Get metrics for pins created in the last &quot;n&quot; days. | Integer | (x) |null |  | [30] ||ad_account_id |Unique identifier of an ad account. | String | (x) |null | /^\\d+$/ |  |

        ||Field Name||Required||Type||Description||Enum||Example||
         |account_type |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}String{noformat} | Type of account |  [PINNER, BUSINESS]  | null
         |id |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}String{noformat} | User account ID. |  | 2783136121146311751
         |profile_image |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}String{noformat} |  |  | null

        {anchor:AdGroupCommonTrackingUrlsModelAnchor}
        h3. AdGroupCommonTrackingUrls

        Third-party tracking URLs.<br> JSON object with the format: \{"<a href="https://developers.pinterest.com/docs/redoc/#section/Tracking-URL-event">Tracking event enum</a>":[URL string array\],...\}<br> For example: \{"impression": ["URL1", "URL2"\], "click": ["URL1", "URL2", "URL3"\]\}.<br>Up to three tracking URLs are supported for each event type. Tracking URLs set at the ad group or ad level can override those set at the campaign level. May be null. Pass in an empty object - \{\} - to remove tracking URLs.<br><br> For more information, see <a href="https://help.pinterest.com/en/business/article/third-party-and-dynamic-tracking" target="_blank">Third-party and dynamic tracking</a>.

        
        ||Field Name||Required||Type||Description||Enum||Example||
         |impression |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}array[String]{noformat} |  |  | null
         |click |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}array[String]{noformat} |  |  | null
         |engagement |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}array[String]{noformat} |  |  | null
         |buyable_button |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}array[String]{noformat} |  |  | null
         |audience_verification |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}array[String]{noformat} |  |  | null

         |engagement_window_days |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}ConversionAttributionWindowDays{noformat} | Number of days to use as the conversion attribution window for an engagement action.         {anchor:AudienceRuleModelAnchor}
        h3. AudienceRule

        JSON object defining targeted audience users. Example rule formats per audience type:<br>CUSTOMER_LIST: \{ "customer_list_id": "&lt;customer list ID&gt;"\}<br>ACTALIKE: \{ "seed_id": ["&lt;audience ID&gt;"\], "country": "US", "percentage": "10" \}<br>(Valid countries include: "US", "CA", and "GB". Percentage should be 1-10.<br>The targeted audience should be this % size across Pinterest.)<br>VISITOR: \{ "visitor_source_id": ["&lt;conversion tag ID&gt;"\], "retention_days": "180", "event_source": \{"=": ["web", "mobile"\]\}, "ingestion_source": \{"=": ["tag"\]\}\}<br>(Retention days should be 1-540. Retention applies to specific customers.)<br>ENGAGEMENT: \{"engagement_domain": ["www.entomi.com"\], "engager_type": 1\}<br>For more details on engagement audiences, see <a href="https://developers.pinterest.com/docs/redoc/adtech_ads_v4/#section/November-2021" target="_blank">November 2021 changelog</a>.

        
        ||Field Name||Required||Type||Description||Enum||Example||
         |country |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}String{noformat} | Valid countries include: &quot;US&quot;, &quot;CA&quot;, and &quot;GB&quot;. |  | US
         |customer_list_id |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}String{noformat} | Customer list ID. For CUSTOMER_LIST &#x60;audience_type&#x60;. |  | 5497558859876
         |engagement_domain |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}array[String]{noformat} | The audience account&#39;s verified domain. **Required** for ENGAGEMENT &#x60;audience_type&#x60;. |  | [&quot;www.somedomain.com&quot;]
         |engagement_type |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}String{noformat} | Engagement type enum. Optional for ENGAGEMENT &#x60;audience_type&#x60;. Supported values are &#x60;click&#x60;, &#x60;save&#x60;, &#x60;closeup&#x60;, &#x60;comment&#x60; and &#x60;like&#x60;. All engagements are included if this field is not set.  |  | click
         |event |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}String{noformat} | A Pinterest tag event. Optional for VISITOR &#x60;audience_type&#x60;. Possible values are &#x60;pagevisit&#x60;, &#x60;signup&#x60;, &#x60;checkout&#x60;, &#x60;viewcategory&#x60;, &#x60;search&#x60;, &#x60;addtocart&#x60;, &#x60;watchvideo&#x60;, &#x60;lead&#x60;, and &#x60;custom&#x60;. This field also accepts a partner-defined Pinterest tag event. |  | checkout
         |event_data |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}PinterestTagEventData{noformat} |  |  | null
         |percentage |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}Integer{noformat} | Percentage should be 1-10. The targeted audience should be this % size across Pinterest. |  | 3
         |pin_id |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}array[String]{noformat} | IDs of engaged organic pins. Optional for ENGAGEMENT &#x60;audience_type&#x60;. For example, &quot;pin_id:&quot;: [&quot;34567&quot;\] |  | [&quot;34567&quot;]
         |prefill |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}Boolean{noformat} | Optional for VISITOR &#x60;audience_type&#x60;. If &#x60;true&#x60;, the specified rule on existing engagement data is applied to pre-populate the audience. If &#x60;false&#x60;, the audience is empty at creation time. The default is &#x60;true&#x60;. |  | true
         |retention_days |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}Integer{noformat} | Number of days a Pinterest user remains in the audience. Optional for ENGAGEMENT and VISITOR &#x60;audience_type&#x60;. Accepted range is 1-540. Defaults to 180 if not specified. |  | 30
         |seed_id |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}array[String]{noformat} | Audience ID(s). For ACTALIKE &#x60;audience_type&#x60;.  |  | [&quot;2542620639259&quot;,&quot;2542620639261&quot;]
         |url |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}array[String]{noformat} | Optional for ENGAGEMENT or VISITOR &#x60;audience_type&#x60;. For ENGAGEMENT, it is the engaged pin&#39;s URL. For VISITOR, you can use it as a string or a \{operator: value\} object for filtering visitors based on conversion tag event URLs. Supported operators are [ &#x3D;, \!&#x3D;, contains, not_contains\].&lt;br&gt;Example 1:  &quot;url&quot;: &quot;http://www.myonlinestore123.com/view_item/shoe&quot;&lt;br&gt;Example 2: &quot;url&quot;: \{&quot;contains&quot;: &quot;/view_item/shoe&quot;\} |  | null
         |visitor_source_id |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}String{noformat} | The conversion tag ID, or the Pinterest tag ID, that you use on your website. For VISITOR &#x60;audience_type&#x60;. |  | 549755885175
         |event_source |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}Object{noformat} | Optional for VISITOR. You can use it as a \{&#39;&#x3D;&#39;: [value\]\}. Supported values are: web, mobile, offline |  | {&quot;&#x3D;&quot;:[&quot;web&quot;,&quot;mobile&quot;]}
         |ingestion_source |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}Object{noformat} | Optional for VISITOR. You can use it as a \{&#39;&#x3D;&#39;: [value\]\}. Supported values are: tag, mmp, file_upload, conversions_api |  | {&quot;&#x3D;&quot;:[&quot;tag&quot;]}
         |engager_type |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}Integer{noformat} | Optional for ENGAGEMENT. Engager type value should be 1-2. |  | 1
         |campaign_id |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}array[String]{noformat} | Campaign ID for engagement audience filter. |  | [&quot;626744528398&quot;]
         |ad_id |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}array[String]{noformat} | Ad ID for engagement audience filter. |  | [&quot;687201361754&quot;]
         |objective_type |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}array[ObjectiveType]{noformat} | Objective for engagement audience filter. |  | [&quot;AWARENESS&quot;]
         |ad_account_id |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}String{noformat} | Ad account ID. |  | 549755885175

        h3. BrandFilter

         |BRAND |(/) |{noformat:nopanel=true}CatalogsProductGroupMultipleStringCriteria{noformat} |  |  | null
         
        {anchor:BudgetTypeModelAnchor}
        h3. BudgetType

        Budget type. If DAILY, an ad group's daily spend will not exceed the budget parameter value. If LIFETIME, the end_time parameter is **REQUIRED**, and the ad group spend is spread evenly between the ad group `start_time` and `end_time` range. A CBO campaign automatically generates ad group budgets from its campaign budget to maximize campaign outcome. For CBO campaigns, only "CBO_ADGROUP" is allowed. For WEB_SESSIONS campaigns, only "LIFETIME" is allowed. For update, only draft ad groups may update budget type.

         ||Name||Value||Description||
          |DAILY |"DAILY" | |
 |LIFETIME |"LIFETIME" | |
 |CBO_ADGROUP |"CBO_ADGROUP" | |

         |entity_ids |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}array[String]{noformat} | All entities specified by these IDs as well as their children and grandchildren will be downloaded if the entity type is one of the types requested to be downloaded. |  | null

        {anchor:CatalogsFeedValidationErrorsModelAnchor}
        h3. CatalogsFeedValidationErrors

        

        
        ||Field Name||Required||Type||Description||Enum||Example||
         |FETCH_ERROR |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}Integer{noformat} | Pinterest couldn&#39;t download your feed. |  | null
         |FETCH_INACTIVE_FEED_ERROR |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}Integer{noformat} | Your feed wasn&#39;t ingested because it hasn’t changed in the previous 90 days. |  | null
         |ENCODING_ERROR |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}Integer{noformat} | Your feed includes data with an unsupported encoding format. |  | null
         |DELIMITER_ERROR |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}Integer{noformat} | Your feed includes data with formatting errors. |  | null
         |REQUIRED_COLUMNS_MISSING |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}Integer{noformat} | Your feed is missing some required column headers. |  | null
         |DUPLICATE_PRODUCTS |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}Integer{noformat} | Some products are duplicated. |  | null
         |IMAGE_LINK_INVALID |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}Integer{noformat} | Some image links are formatted incorrectly. |  | null
         |ITEMID_MISSING |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}Integer{noformat} | Some items are missing an item id in their product metadata, those items will not be published. |  | null
         |TITLE_MISSING |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}Integer{noformat} | Some items are missing a title in their product metadata, those items will not be published. |  | null
         |DESCRIPTION_MISSING |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}Integer{noformat} | Some items are missing a description in their product metadata, those items will not be published. |  | null
         |PRODUCT_LINK_MISSING |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}Integer{noformat} | Some items are missing a link URL in their product metadata, those items will not be published. |  | null
         |IMAGE_LINK_MISSING |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}Integer{noformat} | Some items are missing an image link URL in their product metadata, those items will not be published. |  | null
         |AVAILABILITY_INVALID |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}Integer{noformat} | Some items are missing an availability value in their product metadata, those items will not be published. |  | null
         |PRODUCT_PRICE_INVALID |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}Integer{noformat} | Some items have price formatting errors in their product metadata, those items will not be published. |  | null
         |LINK_FORMAT_INVALID |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}Integer{noformat} | Some link values are formatted incorrectly. |  | null
         |PARSE_LINE_ERROR |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}Integer{noformat} | Your feed contains formatting errors for some items. |  | null
         |ADWORDS_FORMAT_INVALID |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}Integer{noformat} | Some adwords links contain too many characters. |  | null
         |INTERNAL_SERVICE_ERROR |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}Integer{noformat} | We experienced a technical difficulty and were unable to ingest your feed. The next ingestion will happen in 24 hours. |  | null
         |NO_VERIFIED_DOMAIN |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}Integer{noformat} | Your merchant domain needs to be claimed. |  | null
         |ADULT_INVALID |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}Integer{noformat} | Some items have invalid adult values. |  | null
         |IMAGE_LINK_LENGTH_TOO_LONG |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}Integer{noformat} | Some items have image_link URLs that contain too many characters, so those items will not be published. |  | null
         |INVALID_DOMAIN |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}Integer{noformat} | Some of your product link values don&#39;t match the verified domain associated with this account. |  | null
         |FEED_LENGTH_TOO_LONG |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}Integer{noformat} | Your feed contains too many items, some items will not be published. |  | null
         |LINK_LENGTH_TOO_LONG |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}Integer{noformat} | Some product links contain too many characters, those items will not be published. |  | null
         |MALFORMED_XML |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}Integer{noformat} | Your feed couldn&#39;t be validated because the xml file is formatted incorrectly. |  | null
         |PRICE_MISSING |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}Integer{noformat} | Some products are missing a price, those items will not be published. |  | null
         |FEED_TOO_SMALL |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}Integer{noformat} | Your feed couldn&#39;t be validated because the file doesn&#39;t contain the minimum number of lines required. |  | null
         |MAX_ITEMS_PER_ITEM_GROUP_EXCEEDED |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}Integer{noformat} | Some items exceed the maximum number of items per item group, those items will not be published. |  | null
         |ITEM_MAIN_IMAGE_DOWNLOAD_FAILURE |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}Integer{noformat} | Some items&#39; main images can&#39;t be found. |  | null

        {anchor:CatalogsHotelFeedsCreateRequestModelAnchor}
        h3. CatalogsHotelFeedsCreateRequest

        Request object for creating a feed. Please, be aware that "default_country" and "default_locale" are not required in the spec for forward compatibility but for now the API will not accept requests without those fields.

        
        ||Field Name||Required||Type||Description||Enum||Example||
         |default_currency |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}NullableCurrency{noformat} |  |  | null
         |name |(/) |{noformat:nopanel=true}String{noformat} | A human-friendly name associated to a given feed. |  | null
         |format |(/) |{noformat:nopanel=true}CatalogsFormat{noformat} |  |  | null
         |default_locale |(/) |{noformat:nopanel=true}CatalogsFeedsCreateRequest_default_locale{noformat} |  |  | null
         |credentials |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}CatalogsFeedCredentials{noformat} |  |  | null
         |location |(/) |{noformat:nopanel=true}String{noformat} | The URL where a feed is available for download. This URL is what Pinterest will use to download a feed for processing. |  | null
         |preferred_processing_schedule |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}CatalogsFeedProcessingSchedule{noformat} |  |  | null
         |catalog_type |(/) |{noformat:nopanel=true}CatalogsType{noformat} |  |  | null

        h3. CatalogsProductGroupStatus

        

         ||Name||Value||Description||
          |ACTIVE |"ACTIVE" | |
 |INACTIVE |"INACTIVE" | |
         
        
        {anchor:CatalogsProductGroupTypeModelAnchor}
        h3. CatalogsProductGroupType

        <p>Catalog product group type</p>
<p>MERCHANT_CREATED: Product groups created by merchants.
<br>ALL_PRODUCTS: Consists of every product in your latest successful feed upload.
<br>BEST_DEALS: Consists of products with the deepest drop in price.
<br>PINNER_FAVORITES: Consists of products that are resonating most with people on Pinterest, based on engagement.
<br>TOP_SELLERS: Consists of products with the highest conversion rate, if you have the conversion tag installed.
<br>BACK_IN_STOCK: Consists of products that were previously out of stock and are now in stock.
<br>NEW_ARRIVALS: Consists of products that are new to your Catalog.
<br>SHOPIFY_COLLECTION: Product groups created based on Shopify Product Collections.
<br>I2PC: Product groups created based on predicted product category.</p>

         ||Name||Value||Description||
          |MERCHANT_CREATED |"MERCHANT_CREATED" | |
 |ALL_PRODUCTS |"ALL_PRODUCTS" | |
 |BEST_DEALS |"BEST_DEALS" | |
 |PINNER_FAVORITES |"PINNER_FAVORITES" | |
 |TOP_SELLERS |"TOP_SELLERS" | |
 |BACK_IN_STOCK |"BACK_IN_STOCK" | |
 |NEW_ARRIVALS |"NEW_ARRIVALS" | |
 |SHOPIFY_COLLECTIONS |"SHOPIFY_COLLECTIONS" | |
 |I2PC |"I2PC" | |

        h3. ConversionApiResponse

        Schema describing the object in the response, which contains information about the events that were received and processed.

        
        ||Field Name||Required||Type||Description||Enum||Example||

         |num_events_processed |(/) |{noformat:nopanel=true}Integer{noformat} | Number of events that were successfully processed from the events. |  | null
         |events |(/) |{noformat:nopanel=true}array[ConversionApiResponse_events_inner]{noformat} | Specific messages for each event received. The order will match the order in which the events were received in the request. |  | null

         |warning_message |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}String{noformat} | Warning messages about any fields in the event which are not standard. These are not critical to event processing. |  | null

         |event_name |(/) |{noformat:nopanel=true}String{noformat} | The type of the user event.          |action_source |(/) |{noformat:nopanel=true}String{noformat} | The source indicating where the conversion event occurred. &lt;li&gt;&lt;code&gt;app_android&lt;/code&gt; &lt;li&gt;&lt;code&gt;app_ios&lt;/code&gt; &lt;li&gt;&lt;code&gt;web&lt;/code&gt; &lt;li&gt;&lt;code&gt;offline&lt;/code&gt; |  | app_ios

         |event_source_url |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}String{noformat} | URL of the web conversion event. |  | https://www.my-clothing-shop.org/

        {anchor:ConversionEventsUserDataModelAnchor}
        h3. ConversionEventsUserData

        Object containing customer information data. Note, It is required at least one of 1) em, 2) hashed_maids or 3) pair client_ip_address + client_user_agent.

        
        ||Field Name||Required||Type||Description||Enum||Example||
         |ph |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}array[String]{noformat} | Sha256 hashes of user&#39;s phone numbers, only digits with country code, area code, and number. Remove any symbols, letters, spaces and leading zeros. We highly recommend this on checkout events at least. It may improve reporting performance such as ROAS/CPA. |  | [&quot;45df139772a81b6011bdc1c9cc3d1cb408fc0b10ec0c5cb9d4d4e107f0ddc49d&quot;]
         |ge |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}array[String]{noformat} | Sha256 hashes of user&#39;s gender, in lowercase. Either &quot;f&quot; or &quot;m&quot; or &quot;n&quot; for non-binary gender. |  | [&quot;0d248e82c62c9386878327d491c762a002152d42ab2c391a31c44d9f62675ddf&quot;]
         |db |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}array[String]{noformat} | Sha256 hashes of user&#39;s date of birthday, given as year, month, and day. |  | [&quot;d4426a0086d10f12ad265539ae8d54221dc67786053d511407204b76e99d7739&quot;]
         |ln |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}array[String]{noformat} | Sha256 hashes of user&#39;s last name, in lowercase. We highly recommend this on checkout events at least.          |fn |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}array[String]{noformat} | Sha256 hashes of user&#39;s first name, in lowercase. We highly recommend this on checkout events at least.          |ct |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}array[String]{noformat} | Sha256 hashes of user&#39;s city, in lowercase, and without spaces or punctuation. User residency city (mostly billing). |  | [&quot;4ac01a129bfd10385c9278c2cf2c46fac5ab57350841234f587c8522a2e4ce36&quot;]

Should keyword be archived?&lt;br&gt;3. &quot;bid&quot;: number&lt;br&gt;For example: [\{&quot;id&quot;:&quot;2886610576653&quot;, &quot;archived&quot;: false, &quot;bid&quot;: 20000\}, \{&quot;id&quot;:&quot;2886610576654&quot;,  &quot;archived&quot;: true, &quot;bid&quot;: 20000\}, ...\] |  | null

        {anchor:OauthAccessTokenRequestCodeModelAnchor}
        h3. OauthAccessTokenRequestCode

        A request to exchange an authorization code for an access token.

        
        ||Field Name||Required||Type||Description||Enum||Example||
         |grant_type |(/) |{noformat:nopanel=true}String{noformat} |  |  [authorization_code, refresh_token]  | null
         |code |(/) |{noformat:nopanel=true}String{noformat} |  |  | null
         |redirect_uri |(/) |{noformat:nopanel=true}String{noformat} |  |  | null
         
        {anchor:OauthAccessTokenRequestRefreshModelAnchor}
        h3. OauthAccessTokenRequestRefresh

        A request to exchange a refresh token for a new access token.

        
        ||Field Name||Required||Type||Description||Enum||Example||
         |grant_type |(/) |{noformat:nopanel=true}String{noformat} |  |  [authorization_code, refresh_token]  | null
         |refresh_token |(/) |{noformat:nopanel=true}String{noformat} |  |  | null
         |scope |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}String{noformat} |  |  | null
         |refresh_on |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}Boolean{noformat} | Setting this field to &lt;code&gt;true&lt;/code&gt; will add a new refresh token to your 200 response, as well as the refresh_token_expires_in and refresh_token_expires_at fields. To see the structure of this payload, set the 200 response_type to &quot;everlasting_refresh&quot;. |  | null
         
        {anchor:OauthAccessTokenResponseModelAnchor}
        h3. OauthAccessTokenResponse

        A successful OAuth access token response.

        
        ||Field Name||Required||Type||Description||Enum||Example||
         |response_type |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}String{noformat} |  |  [authorization_code, refresh_token]  | null
         |access_token |(/) |{noformat:nopanel=true}String{noformat} |  |  | null
         |token_type |(/) |{noformat:nopanel=true}String{noformat} |  |  | null
         |expires_in |(/) |{noformat:nopanel=true}Integer{noformat} |  |  | null
         |scope |(/) |{noformat:nopanel=true}String{noformat} |  |  | null
         
        {anchor:OauthAccessTokenResponseCodeModelAnchor}
        h3. OauthAccessTokenResponseCode

        A successful OAuth access token response for the authorization code flow.

        
        ||Field Name||Required||Type||Description||Enum||Example||
         |response_type |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}String{noformat} |  |  [authorization_code, refresh_token]  | null
         |access_token |(/) |{noformat:nopanel=true}String{noformat} |  |  | null
         |token_type |(/) |{noformat:nopanel=true}String{noformat} |  |  | null
         |expires_in |(/) |{noformat:nopanel=true}Integer{noformat} |  |  | null
         |scope |(/) |{noformat:nopanel=true}String{noformat} |  |  | null
         |refresh_token |(/) |{noformat:nopanel=true}String{noformat} |  |  | null
         |refresh_token_expires_in |(/) |{noformat:nopanel=true}Integer{noformat} |  |  | null
         
        {anchor:OauthAccessTokenResponseEverlastingRefreshModelAnchor}
        h3. OauthAccessTokenResponseEverlastingRefresh

        A successful OAuth access token response for the refresh token flow, with an added everlasting refresh token.

        
        ||Field Name||Required||Type||Description||Enum||Example||
         |response_type |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}String{noformat} |  |  [authorization_code, refresh_token]  | null
         |access_token |(/) |{noformat:nopanel=true}String{noformat} |  |  | null
         |token_type |(/) |{noformat:nopanel=true}String{noformat} |  |  | null
         |expires_in |(/) |{noformat:nopanel=true}Integer{noformat} |  |  | null

        {anchor:ObjectiveTypeModelAnchor}
        h3. ObjectiveType

        Campaign objective type. If set as one of ["AWARENESS", "CONSIDERATION", "WEB_CONVERSION", "CATALOG_SALES"\] the campaign is considered as a Campaign Budget Optimization (CBO) campaign, meaning budget needs to be set at the campaign level rather than at the ad group level. ["WEB_SESSIONS"\] in BETA. For update, only draft campaigns may update objective type.

         ||Name||Value||Description||
          |AWARENESS |"AWARENESS" | |
 |CONSIDERATION |"CONSIDERATION" | |
 |VIDEO_VIEW |"VIDEO_VIEW" | |
 |WEB_CONVERSION |"WEB_CONVERSION" | |
 |CATALOG_SALES |"CATALOG_SALES" | |
 |WEB_SESSIONS |"WEB_SESSIONS" | |

        {anchor:PacingDeliveryTypeModelAnchor}
        h3. PacingDeliveryType

        Ad group pacing delivery type. With ACCELERATED, an ad group budget is spent as fast as possible. With STANDARD, an ad group budget is spent smoothly over a day. When using CBO, only the STANDARD pacing delivery type is allowed.

         ||Name||Value||Description||
          |STANDARD |"STANDARD" | |
 |ACCELERATED |"ACCELERATED" | |

        {anchor:PinterestTagEventDataModelAnchor}
        h3. PinterestTagEventData

        Optional for VISITOR `audience_type`. With the Pinterest tag, you can use event data to capture event details from your website. This object lists all the available predefined event data fields in the Pinterest tag. You can include these event data fields as part of a VISITOR audience’s `rule`; however, you **must** specify an `event` for the `event_data` fields to be evaluated. Besides what’s listed, you can also create your own set of `event_data` fields and define their usages or purposes according to your website needs. However, the benefit of using the predefined event data fields is that we can provide various metrics based on those fields' data.<br>Examples per `event` type:<br>`pagevisit`<br>"event_data": \{ "page_name": "My online store 123 \| view items \| shoe" \}<br>`signup`<br>"event_data": \{ "lead_type": "New release promotion" \}<br>`checkout`<br>"event_data": \{ "value": 116, "order_quantity": 2, "currency": "USD", "line_items": [ \{ "product_name": "Pillows (Set of 2)", "product_id": "11", "product_price": 48, "product_quantity": 1 \}, \{ "product_name": "Pillows, Large (Set of 2)", "product_id": "15", "product_price": 68, "product_quantity": 1 \} \] \}<br>`addtocart`<br>"event_data": \{ "value": 499, "order_quantity": 1, "currency": "USD", "line_items": [ \{ "product_name": "Red leather boots", "product_id": "3486", "product_category": "shoe", "product_variant_id": "JB11103000", "product_price": 499, "product_quantity": "1", "product_brand": "My brand" \}\]\}<br>`watchvideo`<br>"event_data": \{ "video_title": "My Product Video 01" \}<br>`lead`<br>"event_data": \{ "lead_type": "Newsletter" \}

        
        ||Field Name||Required||Type||Description||Enum||Example||
         |currency |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}Currency{noformat} |  |  | null
         |lead_type |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}String{noformat} | Promotion code. For example, &quot;Newsletter&quot;. |  | Newsletter
         |line_items |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}LineItem{noformat} |  |  | null
         |order_id |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}String{noformat} | Order ID. For example, &quot;X-151481&quot;. |  | X-151481
         |order_quantity |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}Integer{noformat} | Order quantity. For example, 1. |  | 1
         |page_name |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}String{noformat} | Page name. For example, &quot;Our Favorite Pins on Pinterest&quot;. |  | Our Favorite Pins on Pinterest.
         |promo_code |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}String{noformat} | Promotion code. For example, &quot;WINTER10&quot;. |  | WINTER10
         |property |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}String{noformat} | Property. For example, &quot;Athleta&quot;. |  | Athleta
         |search_query |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}String{noformat} | Search query string. For example, &quot;boots&quot;. |  | boots
         |value |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}String{noformat} | Product value. For example, &quot;199.98&quot; |  | 199.98
         |video_title |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}String{noformat} | Video title. For example, &quot;How to style your Parker Boots&quot;. |  | How to style your Parker Boots

        {anchor:TargetingSpecModelAnchor}
        h3. TargetingSpec

        Ad group targeting specification defining the ad group target audience. For example, \{"APPTYPE":["iphone"\], "GENDER":["male"\], "LOCALE":["en-US"\], "LOCATION":["501"\], "AGE_BUCKET":["25-34"\]\}

        
        ||Field Name||Required||Type||Description||Enum||Example||
         |AGE_BUCKET |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}array[String]{noformat} | Age ranges. If the AGE_BUCKET field is missing, the default behavior in terms of ad delivery is that **All age buckets** will be targeted. |    | [&quot;35-44&quot;,&quot;50-54&quot;]
         |APPTYPE |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}array[String]{noformat} | Allowed devices. If the APPTYPE field is missing, the default behavior in terms of ad delivery is that **All devices/apptypes** will be targeted. |    | [&quot;ipad&quot;,&quot;iphone&quot;]
         |AUDIENCE_EXCLUDE |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}array[String]{noformat} | Excluded customer list IDs. Used to drive new customer acquisition goals. For example: [&quot;2542620905475&quot;\]. Audience lists need to have at least 100 people with Pinterest accounts in them. If the AUDIENCE_EXCLUDE field is missing, the default behavior in terms of ad delivery is that **No users will be excluded**. |  | null
         |AUDIENCE_INCLUDE&#39; |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}array[String]{noformat} | Targeted customer list IDs. For example: [&quot;2542620905473&quot;\]. Audience lists need to have at least 100 people with Pinterest accounts in them Audience lists need to have at least 100 people with Pinterest accounts in them. If the AUDIENCE_INCLUDE field is missing, the default behavior in terms of ad delivery is that **All users will be included**. |  | null
         |GENDER |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}array[String]{noformat} | Targeted genders. Values: [&quot;unknown&quot;,&quot;male&quot;,&quot;female&quot;\]. If the GENDER field is missing, the default behavior in terms of ad delivery is that **All genders will be targeted**. |    | null
         |GEO |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}array[String]{noformat} | Location region codes, e.g., &quot;BE-VOV&quot; (East Flanders, Belgium) For complete list, &lt;a href&#x3D;&quot;https://help.pinterest.com/sub/helpcenter/partner/pinterest_location_targeting_codes.xlsx&quot; target&#x3D;&quot;_blank&quot;&gt;click here&lt;/a&gt; or postal codes, e.g., &quot;US-94107&quot;. Use either region codes or postal codes but not both. If the GEO field is missing, the default behavior in terms of ad delivery is that **No geos will be selected**. |  | null
         |INTEREST |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}array[String]{noformat} | Array of interest object IDs. If the INTEREST field is missing, the default behavior in terms of ad delivery is that **All interests will be targeted**. |  | null
         |LOCALE |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}array[String]{noformat} | 24 ISO 639-1 two letter language codes. If the LOCALE field is missing, the default behavior in terms of ad delivery is that **All languages will be target, only english non-sublanguage will be targeted**. |  | null
         |LOCATION |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}array[String]{noformat} | 22 ISO Alpha 2 two letter country codes or US Nielsen DMA (Designated Market Area) codes (location region codes) (e.g., [&quot;US&quot;, &quot;807&quot;\]). For complete list, click here. Location-Country and Location-Metro codes apply. If the LOCATION field is missing, the default behavior in terms of ad delivery is that **Selects default country if not specified (US) and all regions within that country**. |  | null
         |SHOPPING_RETARGETING |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}array[TargetingSpec_SHOPPING_RETARGETING]{noformat} | Array of object: lookback_window	[Integer\]: Number of days ago to start lookback timeframe for dynamic retargeting tag_types [Array of integer\]: Event types to target for dynamic retargeting exclusion_window [Integer\]: Number of days ago to stop lookback timeframe for dynamic retargeting |  | null
         |TARGETING_STRATEGY |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}array[String]{noformat} |  |    | null
         
        {anchor:TargetingSpecSHOPPINGRETARGETINGModelAnchor}

         |tag_types |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}array[Integer]{noformat} | Event types to target for dynamic retargeting |  | [0,6]

        {anchor:TrackingUrlsModelAnchor}
        h3. TrackingUrls

        Third-party tracking URLs. Up to three tracking URLs - with a max length of 2,000 - are supported for each event type. Tracking URLs set at the ad group or ad level can override those set at the campaign level. For more information, see <a href="https://help.pinterest.com/en/business/article/third-party-and-dynamic-tracking" target="_blank">Third-party and dynamic tracking</a>.

        
        ||Field Name||Required||Type||Description||Enum||Example||
         |impression |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}array[String]{noformat} |  |  | null
         |click |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}array[String]{noformat} |  |  | null
         |engagement |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}array[String]{noformat} |  |  | null
         |buyable_button |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}array[String]{noformat} |  |  | null
         |audience_verification |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}array[String]{noformat} |  |  | null

        {anchor:TrendingKeywordsResponseModelAnchor}
        h3. TrendingKeywordsResponse

        

        
        ||Field Name||Required||Type||Description||Enum||Example||
         |trends |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}array[TrendingKeywordsResponse_trends_inner]{noformat} | The top trending keywords for the specified trend type in the requested region.&lt;br /&gt;
Results are ordered, with the first element in the array representing the #1 top trend. |  | null
         
        {anchor:TrendingKeywordsResponseTrendsInnerModelAnchor}
        h3. TrendingKeywordsResponseTrendsInner

        

        
        ||Field Name||Required||Type||Description||Enum||Example||
         |keyword |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}String{noformat} | The keyword that is trending. |  | couples halloween costumes
         |pct_growth_wow |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}Integer{noformat} | The week-over-week percent change in search volume for this keyword.&lt;br /&gt;
For example, a value of &quot;50&quot; would represent a 50% increase in searches in the last seven days compared to the week prior.&lt;br /&gt;
**Note**: growth rates are rounded, with a maximum of +/- 10000% change.  A value of 10001 indicates that this keyword experienced &gt; 10000% week-over-week growth. |  | 50
         |pct_growth_mom |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}Integer{noformat} | The month-over-month percent change in search volume for this keyword.&lt;br /&gt;
For example, a value of &quot;400&quot; would represent a 400% increase in searches in the last 30 days compared to the month prior.&lt;br /&gt;
**Note**: growth rates are rounded, with a maximum of +/- 10000% change.  A value of 10001 indicates that this keyword experienced &gt; 10000% month-over-month growth. |  | 400
         |pct_growth_yoy |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}Integer{noformat} | The year-over-year percent change in search volume for this keyword.&lt;br /&gt;
For example, a value of &quot;-5&quot; would represent a 5% decrease in searches in the last 365 days compared to the month prior.&lt;br /&gt;
**Note**: growth rates are rounded, with a maximum of +/- 10000% change.  A value of 10001 indicates that this keyword experienced &gt; 10000% year-over-year growth. |  | -5
         |time_series |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}TrendingKeywordsResponse_trends_inner_time_series{noformat} |  |  | null
         
        {anchor:TrendingKeywordsResponseTrendsInnerTimeSeriesModelAnchor}
        h3. TrendingKeywordsResponseTrendsInnerTimeSeries

        A sequence of weekly observations of the relative search volume for this keyword over the past year.<br />
These values are normalized to a [0-100\] range, and can be used to visualize the history of user interest in this keyword.
By default, normalization is applied independently to the time series of each keyword, but the `normalize_against_group` query parameter can be used in cases where you wish to compare relative volume between keywords.<br />
**Note**: The date of each observation is in ISO-8601 format and represents the *end* of the week.  For example, a value of `2023-10-31` would include searches that happened between `2023-10-25` and `2023-10-31`.

        
        ||Field Name||Required||Type||Description||Enum||Example||
         |date |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}date{noformat} |  |  | null
